La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de cafetin,ella prepara sandwich,cafes,leches,tortas y pasteles,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de cafetin.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como leche,panes,pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member continues to work in her cafe. She makes sandwiches, coffee, cakes and pastries. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. With this business, the member supports her children. The member's dream is to expand and to improve her cafe. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase products for cooking like milk, bread, chicken and meat. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: purchase products for cooking like milk, bread, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi, a mother of four children, is married to Zuma who works as a farmer. Mnyazi has operated a vegetable stall for 10 years, selling her goods at the market. Her primary customers are neighbouring residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of services, and her highest monthly expense as food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mnyazi will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase stocks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions, and aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima is 36 years old and has two children. She lives in Logan Town.  She sells rice, onion, oil, and others items, which she has been doing for six years. She started this business by selling to friends.

Maima is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more rice, onion, oil, and others items for her business. In the future, she wishes to build a store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, onion, oil, and others items.

loans.name: Violo

texts.en: Violo  is 40 years old and lives in  Caldwell. She’s married and her husband  works with a construction company. They have six children that are attending school and live at home. Violo has been selling juice, rice, oil, and cold water for the past six years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more juice, rice, oil, and cold water  for her business. She plans to send her children to college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more juice, rice, oil, and cold water  for her business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 27-year-old married woman. She has three children and two are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Emmanuel and he operates a posho mill grinding maize. Joy raises goats for their meat and sells her animals at the market. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are neighbours. 

Joy's other source of income includes income from her husband. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Joy will use the Kes 30,000 loan to renovate her house and buy goats to raise for meat. Joy aspires to open a butcher's shop in the future. She joined Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to renovate her house and buy goats to raise for meat.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 49 years old and married with three children. She has practiced farming in Ol’kalou for the last four years. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting during this planting season. 


In the future, Catherine hopes to improve her farming methods and make more profits thereby providing a good living standard for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She has a retail shop at the market selling cereals. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of beans and groundnuts. 

Madina's major business challenges are seasonality and increasing prices of cereals in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stationery and equipment for her business

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 56 years old, married, and has five children. He is a farmer, which he has been doing for three years. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

Pius is requesting his third loan for 60,000 KES, which he will use to purchase farm inputs in preparation for the planting season. The anticipated profit will help pay school fees for his children. He dreams of being a successful farmer in the region.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia  is a fishmonger in Nyame Bekyere near Abura. She buys fresh fish and fries it for sale. Afia  has been in this business for 15 years now. She is married to a fisherman and has four children.  Afia uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills.  She will use her loan to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to fry for sale. With the new profit Afia wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a hairdresser. She operates a beauty salon, which she has done for five  years now. Abigail is single and  she lives at Jukwa near Abura. She uses her income  to pay her utility and accomodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase hair extensions, wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.  With the new profit, Abigail will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase hair extensions, wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 25 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is living with her boyfriend and along with two children ages 3 and 4. For two years now she has been selling rice in the market. She stated this business with one thousand Liberian dollars($1,000 LD) given to her by her boyfriend. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more rice  for her business. She hopes to build her own house and improve her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice  for her business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi  is married to a teacher and has one child. She is a seamstress and also bakes meat pies to sell.  She has been sewing for 15 years.  She uses her income to help to pay their accommodation bills. 

Esi is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase fabrics for the dresses she sews to sell. She will also use some of the loan to purchase flour and other ingredients to bake her meat pies.  With the profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for dresses and flour and other ingredient for meat pies.

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis is 44 years old, a married man and blessed with five children aged 20, 16, 13, 10, and seven years old. He is in the business of panel-beating, a business he has been doing for the past six years, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase a tool box and a gas cylinder for his work. The profit made from his business will aid him in educating his children. 

His dream is to see his business expand as well as educate his children, and this is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase a tool box and a gas cylinder.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka, a 51-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is enrolled in school, is married to Amri, a farmer. For the past 10 years Mwaka has been operating a poultry farm, selling her goods from home, primarily to neighbours. Mwaka's other source of income is farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of food, and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwaka will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase chicks and poultry feeds, and aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to get loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old and a mother of four children. She operates a tailoring business where she mends and also makes new dresses for her clients. This lady has been in the business for the last ten years. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for her fourth loan of 100,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to purchase additional clothing material for her business. 

The client will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In future, Elizabeth hopes to grow her business as well as venture into other businesses.

loans.use: to buy  materials for  making dresses for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose  lives in New Kru town. She is 28 years old, single, with two children ages 5 and 9, who are in school and live at home. For the past three years she has been operating a small table market where she sells bitter ball (squash), peppers, onions, Vita, and many other items. She started this business by selling dried fish around in her  community with the little goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball, peppers, onions, Vita  and many other items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball (squash), peppers, onions, Vita  and many other items for her business

loans.name: Sabina Esi

texts.en: Sabina is a fishmonger. She sells salted fish ("kako") and other items at Jukwa near Abura. She is married to a driver and has seven children. She has been in this business for the past nine years now. Sabina uses her income to help her husband in the general up-keep of their family. She will use her loan to purchase  to salted fish and other food items for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase  to salted fish and other food items for sale.

loans.name: Saul Neptali

texts.es:
Saúl tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos de 28, 24, 23 y 20 años de edad, y vive con su familia en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Don Saúl se dedica a una actividad de negocio que es la compra y venta de habano. Inicio este negocio hace 9 años empezando con poco producto  vio que este se vendía con mucha facilidad y que era rentable.  Ahora el cuenta con un inventario mas amplio y los vende en puntos de venta  turísticos dentro y fuera  de la ciudad. Con este negocio ha salido adelante con su familia. El esta muy motivado a seguir trabajando y por eso le dedica 8 horas diarias para seguir aumentado sus ingresos.
Este préstamo de 6,000 lempiras lo invertirá en abastecerse en comprar más habano. Aprovechando la temporada alta para vender  y poder incrementar sus ventas.
Su plan es, que con este préstamo su negocio crecerá satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Saúl, age 57, is married and has four children, ages 28, 24, 23, and 20.  He lives with his family in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Saúl has a business of buying and selling cigars.  He started this business nine years ago with little product.  He saw that these sold very easily and that it was profitable.  He now has a larger inventory, and he sells them at tourist sites within and outside of the city.

With this business he has gotten his family ahead.  He is very motivated to keep working, so he works eight hours a day in order to continue increasing his income.

He will use this loan for 6,000 lempiras to stock up and buy more cigars.  He will take advantage of the high season for selling, and he will be able to increase his sales.

His plan is to use this loan for his business to grow satisfactorily.

loans.use: to buy cigars to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children aged 2 and 4 years old. She describes herself to be an honest, trustworthy and patient woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells second-hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located near a busy market  and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of room for her operation as it gets difficult to operate during the rainy season. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more second-hand clothes.  Lydia's business goal is to run a big boutique within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 45-year-old married woman. She has six children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Charles and he works as area Councillor. Christine operates a tailoring business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 12 years and was previously employed as a secretary. Her primary customers are friends, relatives and passersby. 

Christine's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is fees. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Christine will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. Christine aspires to open a tailoring school in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 54 years old and a mother of four children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes and sells dresses to clients in Malindi town. This lady has been in business for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and she is applying for her third loan of KES 80,000. She intends to use the loan to purchase clothing material for her business. 

She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In future, Agnes hopes to grow her business and venture into other businesses as well.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela is 48 years old. She lives in a village of Kaspi District, East Georgia. Bela is married and lives with her family: her husband – Nugzar, two daughters (25 and 10 years old) and a 19-year-old son. Nugzar is a worker in the village. Bela takes care of a family-owned milk cow. She produces cheese and sells on average 20 kg of this product in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.

Bela requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. With two milk cows, she will be able to increase production and sales of cheese by 100% and the income of the family will increase by 150 Laris. They will be able to purchase additional household goods and to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children and only four of her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells second-hand bags at the market. She has sells her products on both wholesale and retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years .She works seven days a week. 

Ruth has requested a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand bags. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to start importing second-hand shoes and clothes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees  and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand bags

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar is 47 years old. He is married and lives in a village of Mtskheta District with his wife Tsitsi. Emzar and Tsitsi earn their living through agricultural business. They have a peach garden and vineyard. In season Emzar and Tsitsi work in their garden and vineyard. In late summer/fall they sell harvested produce locally to greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris. 

Emzar requested a loan for purchasing medicines to treat his plants for parasites. After properly performed seasonal work the family can count on a good harvest, which will be sold for an appropriate price. The family will get planned income, which will be used for financing family living costs during the year.

loans.use: to purchase drugs for treating plants for parasites

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a 42-year-old married woman. She has seven children and five are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Kahindi. Tabu operates a vegetable kiosk and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are friends, neighbours and passersby. 

Tabu's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her highest monthly expense is fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Tabu will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of dried fish for sale. Tabu aspires to open a  grocery shop and a butchery in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a married woman. She has three children and all three are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Iddi. 

Annet sells charcoal and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are friends, neighbours and passersby. Annet's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. 

She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Annet will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal and renovate her stall. Annet aspires to be a wholesaler in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and renovate her stall.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with seven children and five of her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a retail shop at the market. She also sells piped water from home to earn additional income. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and boxes of soap. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She lives in her own house and  the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has three children and two are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Gideon and he works as a mason. Mary operates selling food and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are the general public. Mary's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mary will use the KES 20,000 loan to renovate her food stall. Mary aspires to be a wholesaler in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to renovate her food stall.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 25 years old. He lives in Mtskheta District, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, Tsitsi, and parents. Giorgi and Tsitsi earn a living through agriculture. They work hard in their 180 square meter greenhouse, where they grow tulips. They sell the flowers in the open market of Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Along with farming tulips, Giorgi works as a tractor operator in the village. He provides tractor repair services to farmers from his and nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Giorgi requested a loan for renovation of the greenhouse and cultivation of the land in it. He will change broken glasses so that the greenhouse can better maintain the correct temperatures. Also, after proper cultivation and fertilization, the land in the greenhouse will produce better quality tulips, which will be sold for higher prices. The family's income will increase, and they will be able to purchase household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and materials for greenhouse renovation.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.en:
Jairo has owned Chien Inc., a home care veterinary service, for over six years. He founded this company after working extensively in the veterinary field and seeing a need for veterinary services that could be mobile and bring care to the patient. This vision, in addition to Jairo’s passion to become an entrepreneur, led to his founding Chien Inc., first established out of his Florida home. 

Originally from Columbia, Jairo’s greatest success has come with the creation of his own business to support his family, and being able to create jobs for others. There is much room for expansion within the local community and Jairo would like to see Chien Inc. continue to grow. He is asking for this loan for two purposes. First, he would like to buy new medical equipment to keep his business fully functioning and the best it can be for his patients. Second, he would like to expand his marketing to reach further and attract a wider clientele.

loans.use: to purchase new medical equipment and expand marketing

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Florence has a food stall at the market, where she sells tomatoes. She has been in this business for the last five years, and she works seven days a week. She earns additional income working as sweeper for the Kampala Capital City Authority. Florence lives in her own house; the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Florence has requested a loan of 1,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of tomatoes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and to start growing tomatoes herself.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urquillos, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Irene  tiene  70 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos la socia  se dedica a la artesanía y lleva a vender sus productos al poblado de Pisac, Ollantaytambo, ella realiza con mantas muñecas, pantalones, chompas, porta lapiceros entre otros pequeños trabajos. La socia desea invertir en la compra de materiales para seguir elaborando sus productos, ella comprara lanas de alpaca, oveja, sintética, botones, forro para el cuerpo de los muñecos, pinceles, agujas, hilos entre otros.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en: The member, Irene, belongs to the Reyna de Los Angelos de Urquillos Communal Bank, located in the district of Urquillos, province of Calca, department of Cusco.  She is a 70 year old widow and has five children.  She is an artisan and sells her products in Pisac and Ollantaytambo.  She makes blankets, dolls, pants, sweaters, pencil holders, and other small crafts.  She is requesting the loan to purchase materials in order to continue creating her products.  She will buy alpaca wool, synthetic sheep wool, buttons, covers for the dolls’ bodies, paintbrushes, needles, thread, and other materials.  Irene is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials in order to continue creating her products.  She will buy alpaca wool, synthetic sheep wool, buttons, covers for the dolls’ bodies, paintbrushes, needles, thread, and other materials.

loans.name: Resba

texts.en:
Resba is a 45-year-old married woman. She has five children, one of whom is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Gwama, and he works as a contractor. Resba operates a shop where she sells her goods. She's worked in this business for three years, and her primary customers are community members. She describes high prices as her greatest business challenge, and her highest monthly expenses are food, fees, and health. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Resba will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and rice. Resba aspires to open a bigger shop in the future. She joined Yehu because it's changing people's lives.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Kaphuli

texts.en: Kaphuli is taking out another Kiva loan of 40,000 KES to boost her retail shop business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour. She dreams of establishing another stall to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour.

loans.name: Crisologa

texts.en:
Crisologa is a 58-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is engaged in farming and fishing.

Crisologa is a food vendor in Dauis, Bohol. She makes pancakes, banana cue, and rice cakes to sell to her community. Crisologa earns 2,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, and bananas. Crisologa hopes for her business to grow and for her family to experience a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, and bananas.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 31-year-old married man with three children. He sells men's clothing and some home products in the central bazaar.  He has 10 years of experience in this field. 

Samir sells seasonal clothes, which are very popular, especially jeans and shirts. He changes his stock every months to keep clients satisfied.  His monthly income is 120 AZN.  His wife helps him to choose the clothes and home products.  The home products he sells are buckets, basins, baskets,  and so on. 

This business is only one financial income for Samir's family and he is trying his best to work harder and cover the needs of his family. He applied for 1500 AZN to purchase more seasonal clothes and home products to sell. He promises to pay on time. This will be his 5th loan and AqroInvest CU trusts him!

loans.use: buy clothes and home products

loans.name: Tai Group

texts.en:
Neema, who is in her late 30s, is single with one child who is still going to school.  She has been selling kitchen ware and sandals for  six years now.  She works from 9:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy more kitchen ware and sandals and for household expenses because she is single.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants a loan to increase her business stock.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tai" which has a total of 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her kitchen ware and sandal stock.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 41 years old. He lives in Kaspi District with his family: his wife – Irma, two sons (16 and 13 years old) and his parents (retired). The children go to school. Zaza sells greengrocery produce from his mini-bus. He purchases greengrocery produce from farmers in his and nearby villages, takes the produce on his mini-bus to nearby towns and sells the products there. Irma is busy with the family agricultural business. In particular, she runs a dairy farm with 2 milk cows and 2 calves. Irma produces yogurt and cheese and sells them in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris, including the monthly pensions of Zaza’s parents. 

Zaza will use the requested credit for increasing turnover in his greengrocery business. In particular, he will increase the assortment and volume of fruit and vegetables, purchased for resale. Zaza will sell more products and his profit will increase. The family will use the increased income for creating better living conditions for their children, as well as other family members.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Flor, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 18 y 12 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio y universidad y aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en un hotel. 

Ella aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en un centro de estudios en esta ciudad.  Con los pocos recursos que tenia y aprovechando sus conocimientos en arreglos y belleza hace varios años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. También vende productos de belleza, para lo cual tiene unas vitrinas, ella lleva más de 14 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y algunas herramientas de trabajo. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño  tener un SPA
texts.en:
The members of 4 de Agosto Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Andrés de Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo, known for many years as the Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos [City of the Royal Tamarind Trees].

Here we met Flor.  She is 39 years old and married, and from this relationship has two children, ages 18 and 12.  Both are studying, in high school and the university, and still live with her.  Her husband works in a hotel.

She learned beauty and personal care in a school in this city.  With the few resources she had, and taking advantage of her knowledge of beauty and personal care, several years ago she set up a beauty salon in her house, where she does a variety of jobs such as dyes, haircuts, and nail painting, among other things.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes until later if her customers need her services.  She also sells beauty products, for which she has some display cases.  She has been doing this work for more than 14 years and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy dyes, perms, and some work tools.  This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help and the profits she receives from the bank.
 
Her dream is to have a spa.

loans.use: to buy dyes, perms, and work tools.

loans.name: Kema

texts.en:
Kema lives in New Kru town. She is 30 years old and single with two children, ages six and eight. Both her children are in school and live at home. For the past three years, Kema has been selling onions, peppers, vita, and other items. She started her business selling rice around in her community with the little goods she could afford. She learned this type of business from her mother. 

Kema is requesting a loan to purchase more stock for sale. She plans to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, peppers, and other items for sale.

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Bonaventure has five children who are between 7 and 20. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 25 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. Other agriculture borrowers were standing behind the picture.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is a 49-year-old married woman with two children, aged 13 and 16. She is a farmer, working in Bien Unido, Bohol. Adelaida and her husband work together cultivating their land and growing rice to sell. Adelaida does her best to keep their farm productive and their children at school. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies. Adelaida hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes to venture into other kinds of business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Revelina

texts.en:
Revelina is 61 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. She is a farmer and works with her husband on their farm. Revelina helps cultivate their land and plant rice crops.  She makes sure to manage her time between farming and taking care of her children.

Revelina is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and other farm inputs. Revelina hopes to have a stable income with farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in New Kru town.  She is 33 years old, married and her husband is a businessman.  They have four children.  For the past four years, she has been selling garri (an African food made of cassava).  She started this business with a loan from her friend and learned this way of selling from her friends.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more garri for her business. Her plans is to expand.

loans.use: buy garri (a local food)

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Ever since arriving in the United States, Gustavo has had an entrepreneurial spirit and the work ethic to support it. When he arrived in the United States in 2007, he took his first job as a gardener's assistant, but strived to work for himself. He soon decided to open his own lawn care service under the name Gustavo Lawn Service. He used his own money to purchase a van and the equipment that it would take to support his business. As he began to acquire clients, he changed the name of his business to Black Pearl Enterprises and began to see even higher success. The heightened success allowed him to buy more equipment and begin to employ assistants. 

Gustavo now serves 260 accounts in his Florida community and hopes to continue to grow his business. He has set up an organized schedule in which he serves his clients and has made room for immediate growth. He would like this loan to purchase more equipment to more efficiently run his business. At this point he sees this as his only set back to further expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to suit more clients

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a dynamic entrepreneur with the fire it takes to own and operate a successful business. He has participated in other self-owned businesses in the past, including his last venture in real estate, and now looks to operate his own courier service. He founded Progressive Concepts Inc. in the greater Boston area and quickly forged a relationship with a large courier contractor, but also wanted to continue to serve local businesses as well.

 Mainly he has targeted his business to support local laboratories, transporting lab results, as well as active experiments. However, in late January, an unlucky twist of fate threatened his business greatly. His main vehicle was involved in a car accident. Jocelyn worked hard to find a temporary solution for this problem, but now needs a new vehicle to continue his business. Jocelyn is looking for a loan to purchase a new vehicle for his courier service so that he can once again operate at full capacity.

loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle for courier service

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, 49, lives in West Point  with five children between 19 and 28 years old. For  years now she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. She received a small amount from her husband  to start her business, and she learned it from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more Bonnie fish, spare ribs,  rice, charcoal and  pig's feet  for her  business. Her  plans is to build a house for  her children.

loans.use: to purchase more Bonnie fish, spare ribs,  rice, charcoal and  pig's feet  for her  business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy ball bearings, brake pumps, brake pads, starters, and ignition coil.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like shampoo, toothpaste, soy sauce, softdrinks and rice. Lucila earns 8000 PHP per month with her business.  She works hard to support her family of a husband and 5 children.

Lucila is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, softdrinks and snacks. This loan will help increase her profitability. Lucila hopes for her business to grow and for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married. He has one child who is four years old. He has been a rice farmer for five years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and make savings for better sustainability.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a farmer, and she has been planting and selling rice for five years. She earns 3,000 PHP per month, and she works hard to support her family: a husband and six school-aged children. Alejandra's husband works as a fishpond operator.

Alejandra needs additional capital for her farm. She requested a loan to purchase four sacks of fertilizer and one sack of rice seeds. Alejandra plans to use any extra income she earns for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her family:  her husband Ilia and her parents. The family lives in a village in the Mtskheta district, near the capital city of the country.  Ilia works as grader driver in the district and gets a monthly salary. Madona and her parents are involved in a family agricultural business, which is the main source of the income for the family. They have a dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Madona produces yogurt and sells it in this and the nearby villages. The total average monthly income for the family is 1000 Laris.

Madona requested credit to purchase calves. She will raise them for 5-6 months and sell the grown cows in early fall for a higher price. The family will get additional income from the sale. Madona plans to reinvest part of the income in the family farm for its further development, and the other part will be used to purchase needed household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Grace    Mary

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! From Tengbehtown, this is 45-year-old Grace, a resident of the western area in Freetown and married mother of three children between the ages of 18 and 25 years. Two of her children attend school.

For 10 years, Grace has operated a pharmacy in Congo town, selling baby cream, multivites syrup, aspirin, choroqiune, injections, and anti-malarial drugs. Working at the business seven days per week, and with one employee, she also works as a private nurse to earn additional income. Grace says that the main challenge to her business is low capital for investment.

Grace has requested a loan to buy more cosmetic and medical drugs. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her children. In the future, she plans to open a bigger medical store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, baby cream and medicines such as anti-malarial drugs.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is 42 years old. She lives in a village in the Tetritskaro district with her family--her husband, Mamuka, her 23-year-old son, and a daughter-in-law. Mamuka is unemployed at the moment, while Irina’s son serves in the country’s army forces. Irina manages the agricultural business of the family. She has a milk cow and makes cheese, which she sells to local dairy product retailers in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris, including the salary of Irina’s son. 

Irina requested a loan for cultivation of the family-owned plot of land, where she plans to sow vegetables. Irina and Mamuka will work hard during the spring and summer months. They will harvest vegetables in the summer, which will be sold in the village to greengrocers. The income of the family will increase, which will help them satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for land cultivation.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Mabel from Krootown central area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is a widow with one child aged 21. Her child is currently at the university. She also takes care of two relatives. 

Mabel runs a boutique at her store; she sells shoes, clothes, perfume, belts, watches, and trousers. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business 10 hours a day and 6 days per week, and has two employees working for her. Her other source of income comes from relatives abroad.  Mabel says that her business is doing well.

Mabel has requested a loan in order to buy more boutique items such as shoes, clothes, perfume, watches, etc. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her savings. In the future, she plans to travel in and out of the country doing larger business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more boutique items such as shoes, clothes, perfume, watches, etc.

loans.name: Ermitaña

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de helados y tambien la socia vende yogures,la socia vende a las diferentes tiendas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de helados y yogures.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos apra comprar leche y azucar al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member, Ermitaña, continues her ice-cream making business and also sells yogurt.  She sells her products at various shops and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Through this business, she helps her children get ahead.  Her dream is to expand her ice-cream and yogurt business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies as well as wholesale milk and sugar.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies as well as wholesale milk and sugar

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a 22-year-old married woman with a four-year-old child; her husband works as a driver.

Anastacia has been in the business of raising pigs for two years.  She says she had to learn how to earn an income because she has a family now. Although Anastacia married at a young age, she does her best to take care of her family and find ways to provide for their needs. She applied for a loan to purchase feed and vitamins, and she hopes her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Water

texts.en: Watta live in New Kru town.  She is 29 years old, single  and has two children ages 5 and 9 who are attending school and live at home.  For the past 3 years, she has been selling potatoes, peppers, bitter balls and many other items.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more potatoes, peppers, bitter balls and others items for her business.  Her plans are to expand her business and to see her children out of high school.

loans.use: buy vegetables and other products

loans.name: Alfiday    B. J.

texts.en:
Alfiday lives in West Point, Liberia with her four children, who are in school. For a year now, she has been selling used clothes. She received a small amount of money from her husband to start her business, which she learned from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a good profit. 

Alfiday is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for sale. Her future plans include building a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Morenikeh

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Morenikeh from Krootown central area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, 15 years old and 20 years old. One of her children is currently attending school. In 1999, Moorenikeh established her boutique business. She began her business because she wanted to enhance her independence and to assist her husband in setting some domestic problem. She also earns income from a commercial taxi. She works at the business 11 hours a day and 6 days per week. She says that her business is going well.

Morenikeh requires a loan in order to buy more boutique items such as slippers, clothes, shoes, bags, cream and perfume. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Morenikeh plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more  boutique items such as slippers, clothes, shoes, bags and perfume

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with has 4 children and two of her children are in school. She supports one additional family member (mother).  

Zam sells bunches of bananas at the market. Her other sources of income include poultry farming and running a restaurant. She has been in business for the last 10 years and she works seven days a week. 

Zam has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas to sell. Her major business challenges are defaulters and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to become a wholesaler.  She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Mamusu is 35 years old and married with one child, who is 23. She runs a used items store in Tengbeh town, Sierra Leone.

She has been in this business for eight years and sells chairs, tires, mattresses, foam, and bags at her store. She also earns income from a commercial taxi. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of capital to increase her investment in her store.

Mamusu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more used items, such as vono mattresses, chairs, and bags. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to contribute to her daughter's schooling. In the future, she would like to own a permanent store in town. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used items for sale.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urquillos, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Maria Cleofe tiene  51 años de edad y es soltera  y tiene 1hijo la socia  se dedica a la administración de sus tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tiendita y la socia también cría cuyes, los cuales cuando se reproducen los vende, la socia es una mujer muy fuerte y desea seguir apoyando y siendo madre y padre para su menor hijo, la socia en esta ocasión invertirá el préstamo en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, entre otros productos para implementar us tienda de abarrotes.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en: The member belongs to the Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos Communal Bank, located in the district of Urquillos, province of Calca, department of Cusco.  Maria Cleofe is 51 years old. She is unmarried and has one son.  She devotes her time to managing her small grocery store.  She also raises guinea pigs, which she sells when they reproduce.  She is strong woman who wants to continue supporting her young son as she is both mother and father to him.  At this time, she in requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and other grocery items to stock her store.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and other grocery items to stock her store.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Judith; tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cuyes y gallinas, ella cria en su casa los hace crecer y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Urubamba y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere tener un lugar más grande donde pueda criar a los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas. 

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Reyna de los Ángeles” (Queen of Angels) communal bank located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  Judith is 30 years old and has a spouse and two children.

She alternates her daily chores with a business selling guinea pigs and chickens.  She raises them at home causing them to grow and then sells them in an ambulatory fashion in the city of Urubamba.  She is able to support her children through this business.  She wants to have a larger place where she can raise her animals and is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.  She is grateful for the requested loan and commits to make her installment payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chicks.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjunto para que de esa forma puedan fortalecer su compañerismo.
Unas de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Zunilda, quien nos comenta que es lavandera. Todos los días ella empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día, lava las prendas que recibe como pedido y de esa forma puede tener el ingreso para dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora y nos dice que  su meta es tener una gran lavandería donde poder dar fuentes de trabajo a otras personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones, enjuagues, suavizantes para ropas y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando. Está muy contenta con la fundación y con Kiva por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank was formed when several neighbors from the city of Santaní joined together.  All the committee members carry out independent activities but they also do group activities to help strengthen their companionship.

One of the group members is Zunilda who tells us that she’s a laundress.  She starts work every day very early washing clothes that she gets as orders.  In this way she can earn income to give her family everything they need.  She is a very hardworking, enterprising woman who tells us that her goal is to have a large laundry where she can offer employment to other people.

She requests the loan to buy soap, rinse, fabric softener and other supplies to continue working.  She is very happy with the Fundación and with Kiva for the help she’s receiving.

loans.use: to buy laundry supplies.

loans.name: Alcione

texts.es: Alcione, tiene 33 años, tiene dos hijos (Angela y Emanuel), es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Alcione es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde ofrece sus productos. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. Alcione se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y limpiar la casa, después ella atiende la tienda desde las 6 a.m. hasta 8 p.m. Alcione requiere el préstamo para comprar cerveza, leche, harina, arroz y azúcar. Alcione pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Ángeles”, ella es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal. El anhelo de la socia es ampliar su tienda. La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alcione, 33, has two children (Ángela and Emanuel).  She is a responsible mother who seeks opportunities at all times to get ahead and with her daily efforts provide a better future for her children.  

Alcione is a hardworking woman who sells foodstuffs like rice, sugar, noodles and milk, for example.  She has a small home-based store where she offers her products.  She’s been in this business for 10 years now and has done very well.

Alcione rises very early to do her household chores like preparing breakfast and cleaning the house and then she tends to the store from 6am until 8pm.  She needs the loan to buy beer, milk, flour, rice and sugar.

Alcione belongs to the “Reyna de Los Ángeles” (Queen of Angels) communal bank and she’s one of its founding members.  Her dream is to expand the store.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided this way and at the same time commits to make her installment payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy beer, milk, flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: Rosalio, tiene 46 años, es natural de la ciudad de Yucay y pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES” de la Asociación Arariwa, él socio tiene un hijo llamado Juan Carlos que tiene 14 años. Rosalio es un padre trabajador y responsable y que se dedica a transportar productos de las Ciudades de Urubamba a Cusco y viceversa, los días martes, jueves y sábado su actividad comercial empieza, cuando a las 9 de la noche la dueña de la mercadería hace cargar sus verduras. El socio sale de la ciudad de Urubamba a las 10 de la noche y llega a la ciudad del Cusco a las 11 de la noche, él socio hace descarga los productos hasta las 2 o 3 de la madrugada y después él socio se va a dormir. El socio regresa al día siguiente a la ciudad de Urubamba llevando comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. El anhelo del socio es comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Yucay y un camión, él para lograr sus sueños esta ahorrando. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y fideos. El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosalío, 46, is from the city of Yucay and belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Reyna de Los Ángeles” (Queen of Angels) communal bank.  He has a son named Juan Carlos who is 14 years old.  

Rosalío is a hardworking, responsible father who works transporting products from the city of Urubamba to Cusco and vice versa Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays.  His commercial activity starts at 9pm when the owner of the merchandise has him loan the vegetables.  He leaves Urubamba at 10pm and arrives in Cusco at 11pm.  He unloads merchandise until 2 or 3 in the morning and then goes to sleep.  He returns to Urubamba the next day bringing back foodstuffs like rice, sugar, noodles, etc.  

His dream is to buy himself a house in the city of Yucay and a truck and to do so he’s saving up.  He needs the loan to buy foodstuffs like rice, sugar and noodles, for example.  He is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and at the same time commits to make his installment payments according to the timeframe.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like rice, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Emprendedoras"se originó a traves de promociones  que fueron hechas en el barrio. Todas las integrantes del grupo son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio. El objetivo de las mismas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La Sra. Maria es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de chipas (Alimento típico paraguayo) en lo que le va muy bien, debido a que el mismo siempre es consumido en todo momento del día y en cualquier época del año. Su meta es poder tener un local grande donde poder ofrecer sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma ayudar a su familia con los gastos del día a día.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" started up as a result of promotions that were done in their neighborhood.  All of the members of this group are from the same neighborhood; they are friends and neighbors.  Their goal is to work together to develop a spirit of solidarity, and to rise to the highest level of the program.  Maria is one of the members of this group.  She has a business selling chipas (cheese filled buns, a traditional Paraguayan snack) which is doing very well, because these are consumed at all hours of the day and during every season of the year.  Her goal is to be able to have a big place where she could offer her products for sale.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy chipas.  With these, she will be able to continue working, and in this way help her family with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy "chipas" to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tires and to service the engine.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de gallinas, ella compra los pollitos pequeños y luego los engorda y los vende en los diferentes ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas al por mayor. 

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the communal bank "Reyna de Los Angeles."  This bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which is in Urubamba province in the department of  Cusco.

Victoria is 48 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business raising chickens.  She buys the little chicks and later fattens them and sells them in the different markets that take place in the city of Urubamba.  Victoria wants to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy more chickens at wholesale.

Victoria is grateful for the loan that she is requesting, and she promises to make all of her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy chickens at wholesale

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis es un hombre de 33 años que vive en la ciudad de Pisco, Perú, lugar actualmente reconocido por el gran avance que ha tenido en la promoción del turismo que se ha venido realizando en los últimos años, este hermoso lugar da la bienvenida a todos sus visitantes con sus hermosas playas y la reconocidísimas “Islas Ballestas”. Es en esta ciudad donde trabaja el señor Jose Luis, un hombre que se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte.

Jose Luis es moto taxista desde hace 9 años, el empezó como chofer en motos alquiladas, pero con el tiempo y mucho esfuerzo logro tener la oportunidad de comprarse una moto taxi propia, la cual ha venido pagando poco a poco en el transcurso de estos años. El disfruta mucho de la actividad que realiza ya siempre le ha gustado transportar a sus clientes.

Actualmente Jose Luis necesita realizar la compra de algunas herramientas y realizarle el mantenimiento pertinente a su moto taxi, es por esto que acudío al programa Kiva, para que de esta manera pueda ser apoyo y cumplir con su objetivo. Jose Luis está seguro que sus ingresos se incrementaran debido a que su moto taxi ya no tendrá ninguna falla y de presentarse alguna, sus herramientas le brindaran el apoyo necesario. 

El es un hombre que a lo largo de estos años se ha venido esforzando mucho por lo que tiene y es por eso que sabe que puede exigirse mucho más aún y así cumplir su gran sueño “Comprar más moto taxis y tener su propia empresa de transporte”.
texts.en:
José Luis is a 33 year old man living in the city of Pisco, Perú, a place currently known for the great advances it’s made in promoting tourism the last few years.  This beautiful place welcomes all visitors to its beautiful beaches and its renowned Ballestas Islands.  It is in this city that José Luis works, a man who is dedicated to providing transportation services.

José Luis has been a taxi driver for 9 years.  He started out driving leased mototaxis but in time and with much effort he managed to get the opportunity to buy his own mototaxi which he’s been paying for little by little over the years.  He enjoys his activity very much because he’s always liked transporting his customers.

Currently, José Luis needs to buy some tools and to pertinent service to his mototaxi and this is why he called on the Kiva program so that it can help him reach his objective.  José Luis is sure that his income will increase because his mototaxi will no longer be malfunctioning and if any malfunction should arise his tools will provide the necessary support.

He is a man who over the years has been exerting himself very much for what he has so he knows that he can still give much more of himself to reach his great dream: “To buy more mototaxis and have his own transportation firm.”

loans.use: to buy tools and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
l comité se Denomina “Nueva Esperanza”  están en el  Ciclo numero 18   con  15  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras  y comentan que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder sacar adelante a sus familias.
Ester trabaja en la venta de perfumes y nos comenta que tiene buena venta, ya que siempre tiene muy buena variedad que ofrece a sus clientes. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y comenta que por medio de su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia y aportar con los gastos del día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Ella está contenta por la ayuda que está recibiendo por parte de kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The committee named "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) is in its 18th cycle with 15 members.  It is a group that is well known in the neighborhood for being very united, cohesive, and responsible.  They are very hardoworking and enterprising women and they comment that they give their maximum effort in order to be able to get ahead for their families.

Ester works selling perfumes and she tells us that her sales are good, since she always has a very wide variety that she offer to her customers.  She is a very hardworking woman and she says that through her job, she has been able to help her family and keep up with the day to day expenses.

She requests this loan in order to purchase perfumes, for men as well as women, with which she will be able to fulfill the orders that she has.  She is happy for the help that she is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Pojoaju Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres de Ciudad del este se Han unido con las ganas de salir adelante y trabajar juntas, y por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Son todas vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad, y han visto en el programa de mujeres de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad de progreso.
Estela es peluquera y nos comenta que tiene un salón bien equipado, en el cual trabaja todos los días. Gracias a Dios tiene muy buena cantidad de clientes, ya que siempre trata de darles un buen servicio 0para que estos estén a gusto. Ella comenta que le gustaría seguir creciendo, para que de esa forma pueda dar trabajo a mas personas que quieran progresar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser: tintes, esmaltes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y demás insumos. Ella nos comenta que están muy contentas con la oportunidad que han recibido.
texts.en:
Sixteen women from Ciudad del Este have united with the desire to get ahead and work together.  Through this joint work, they will be able to help each other.  They are all neighbors and friends from this city, and they have seen the Program for Women of the Fundación Paraguaya as a great opportunity for them to make progress.

Estela is a beautician, and she tells us that she has a well-equipped beauty salon where she works each day.  Thanks to God, she has a large number of customers, because she always tries to provide them with good service so that they will feel comfortable.  She comments that she would like to continue to grow her business, so that she can provide jobs for more people who want to make progress.

Estela is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon, such as: hair dyes, nail polish, creams, shampoo, rinses and other supplies.  She tells us that she is very content with the opportunity that she has received.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Lucy Yanet

texts.es:
Lucy es una joven madre soltera, ella tiene a dos hermosos niños, el mayor de 7 y el menor de 5 añitos, a los que ama mucho y está a dispuesta a esforzarse cada vez más con la finalidad de sacarlos adelante y convertirlos en grandes personas. Esta pequeña familia reside en la ciudad de Pisco, lugar en donde vende todos sus productos de belleza.

Lucy es consultora de productos de belleza desde hace 6 años, ella vende perfumes, cosméticos, ropa interior, entre otros. Ella empezó en este negocio debido a que se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio y que estaña dispuesta a salir a las calles para ofrecer sus productos. Lucy nos comentó en estos 6 años no ha sido fácil para lograr lo que actualmente tiene su pequeño negocio, pero siempre ha sido entusiasta y ha estado segura que saldría adelante.

Actualmente Lucy necesita que los prestatarios Kiva puedan apoyarla y de esta manera realizar la compra de una vitrina nueva para exhibir otros de sus productos, también desea poder comprar algunos productos en oferta tales como perfumes, cosméticos, medias, entre otros. Lucy quiere mejorar su tienda para que sus clientes se sientan incentivados en comprarle, de esta manera mejorará sus ingresos y con esta nueva ganancia podrá darle las comodidades que desea para sus pequeños, y con el tiempo y mucho esfuerzo cumplirá su gran sueño “Ser una madre ejemplar y desde luego un ejemplo de microempresaria”
texts.en:
Lucy is a young single mother of two beautiful children; the older is 7 and the younger is 5 years old.  She loves them very much and is determined to strive more each day to raise them and turn them into great people.  This small family lives in the city of Pisco where she sells her beauty products.

Lucy has been a beauty products consultant for 6 years.  She sells perfume, cosmetics and underwear, among others.  She started in this business because she realized it was a good business and she’d be willing to go out into the streets to sell her products.  Lucy commented that these last six years have not been easy to attain what her small business now has but she’s always been enthusiastic and sure that she’d get ahead.

Lucy currently needs Kiva lenders to support her so that she can buy a new display cases to exhibit her products.  She also wants to buy some products that are on special promotion like perfume, cosmetics and stockings, among others.  Lucy wants to improve her store so that her customers will feel motivated to buy from her so that she will improve income and with the new profits be able to provide the comforts she wants for her small children and in time reach her great dream: “To be an exemplary mother and of course an exemplary micro businesswoman.”

loans.use: to buy a display case, perfume, cosmetics, stockings, etc.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras y productos secos,la socia vende trigo,cebada y maiz,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m ahsta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender las verduras y productos secos.La socia quiere tener un puesto donde pueda vende los productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras y productos secos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is continuing with her business selling vegetables and dried grains.  She sells wheat, barley and corn, and works from 6am until 5pm.  Through this business she provides for her children.  Sebastiana's dream is to have her own place where she could sell vegetables and grains.  She wants to have a post where she could sell her products. Sebastiana is requesting a loan to buy vegetables and dried grains at wholesale.

Sebastiana is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and dried grains at wholesale

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Sagrada Familia debido a que tienen como objetivo trabajar como en familia, dentro del marco del respeto mutuo, actualmente en encuentran en el sexto ciclo con calificación excelente, el grupo está integrada por  15 mujeres que invierten en sus actividades con el fín de mejorar su nivel de vida.
Benita se dedica a la venta de bebidas, y nos comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre tiene mucha variedad de productos. Cuenta que los fines de semana y en fechas especiales es cuando mas ventas tiene. Nos comenta que empezo con un pequeño negocio, pero que despues gracias al exito que tiene fue creciendo y creciendo.
Ella solciita el crédito para la compra de bebidas de todo tipo, como ser gaseosas, cervezas, vinos y otros tipos, con lo cual podrá seguir ofreciendo variedad a swus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee is named Sagrada Familia (Sacred Family) due to their objective of working as a family, inside the framework of mutual respect.  Currently, they are in their sixth cycle with excellent qualifications.  This group is made up of 15 women who invest in their work with the end of improving their quality of life.

Benita works selling beverages and she tells us that she has very good customer since she has a large variety of products.  She comments that the weekends and special days are when she has the most sales.  She tells us that she started with a small business, but that thanks to her success, she later had to grow and grow.

She requests the loan for the purchase of all types of beverages, such as soda, beer, wine and other drinks, with with she will be able to continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase beverages for the business.

loans.name: Moursalou

texts.fr:
Moursalou est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est célibataire.
Moursalou travaille comme revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2008. Deux personnes l’aident dans son activité. L’activité qu’il mène dans une boutique. Sa grande difficulté est de ne pouvoir pas satisfaire ses clients.
Moursalou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Il  voudrait vendre dans les prochaines années les produits congelés et assurer sa future vie maritale.
texts.en:
Moursalou is 28 and single.

He has been working as a reseller of general food products since 2008.  Two people help him with his business, which he conducts in a shop.  His main challenge is that he cannot meet his customers' demand.

Moursalou has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy general food products.  In the coming years he would like to sell frozen products and prepare for his future married life.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es una joven de 18 años de edad que vive en la ciudad de Chincha, Perú. Ella es una joven que disfruta mucho de escuchar su música favorita y tejer algunas prendas u adornos para decorar su casa. Karina es una joven que culminó el colegio hace unos cuantos meses y ya está convertida en una micro-empresaria.

Esta ejemplar muchacha se dedica a la confección y venta de tejido de canastas en la puerta de su casa, este tipo de productos es muy comercializado en la ciudad de Chincha, pueden ofrecer desde sillas hasta carteras, bonitas, simples y coloridas. Karina vive en el centro de donde toda esta actividad se desarrolla, el distrito de “Grocio Prado” conocido principalmente por la beata “MELCHORITA”, una mujer que decidió seguir muy de cerca la vida de Dios, una hermosa historia de fe y gracia.  Es en este lugar en donde las personas venden todo tipo de pulseras y collares con imágenes de “MELCHORITA”, a su vez es el único lugar en donde venden en distintos modelos y diseños las carteras que Karina vende.

Ella nos comenta que fue su madre la que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de este tipo de productos y fue así como Karina aprendió desde muy niña sobre este arte. Actualmente ella cuida y vela por su madre ya que ella ya no puede vender porque su visión no es muy buena, pero en algunas ocasiones ayuda a Karina a tejer, debido a que el arte del tejido se lleva en las manos. Karina sabe que sus productos son de buena calidad y que hace tejido distinto a los demás, emplea un bonito estilo para poder competir. Por el momento ella solo vende los días miércoles y sábados, en el transcurso de la semana ella se dedica a la recepción de pedidos.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Karina podrá realizar la compra de Juncos, Totora, Pintura, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para la confección de sus productos, ella está muy entusiasmada porque sabe que si realiza la compra ahora los materiales le saldrán mucho más baratos, debido a que es esta temporada en donde los precios bajan. Karina tiene una visión a futuro en su fructífero negocio es por ello que quiere fidelizar a su clientes con la variedad de productos ofrecidos, con este incremento de ganancias podrá cumplir su gran sueño “Ser una empresaria exitosa y desde luego aprender otro tipo de arte para ampliar la variedad de sus productos”.
texts.en:
Karina, 18, is a young woman living in the city of Chincha, Perú.  She is a young woman who very much enjoys listening to her favorite music and to knit clothes or home decorations.  Karina completed secondary school a few months ago and has already become a micro businesswoman.

This exemplary young woman works making and selling woven baskets at her doorstep.  This type of product is very popular in the city of Chincha.  One can find on offer from chairs to purses that are pretty, simple and colorful.   Karina lives in the middle of all this activity in the “Grocio Prado” district which is best known for the blessed “Melchorita,” a woman who decided to dedicate her life to following God very closely, a beautiful story of faith and grace.  It is in this place that people sell all types of necklaces and bracelets with images of “Melchorita” and it is also the only place where purses with the designs and styles that Karina sells are found.

She comments that her mother used to work selling this type of product and that’s how Karina learned the art when she was still a little girl.  She currently cares for and takes care of her mother because she can’t sell any more because her eyesight isn’t very good but she sometimes does help Karina knit because the art of knitting is in ones hands.
