Karina knows that her products are good quality and her knitting design is different than all the others.  He uses a pretty style in order to compete.  For the moment she only sells on Wednesdays and Saturdays and during the rest of the week she works securing orders.

With help from Kiva lenders she will be able to buy rushes, reeds and paint, among other materials that are needed to make her products.  She is very excited because she knows that if she buys all her supplies now they will be much less expensive because this is the season when prices drop.

Karina visualizes a successful business in the future and this is why she wants to secure a regular clientele through the variety of products she offers.  This increase in profits will help her reach her great dream: “To become a successful businesswoman and of course learn another type of art to expand the variety of her products.”

loans.use: to buy rushes, reeds, paint and other materials.

loans.name: San Antonio 2 Group

texts.es:
Las Sras. del comité San Antonio II, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a los créditos ellas pueden invertirlos en sus negocios y otras iniciar una actividad comercial.
La presidenta, la señora Gabina vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica al comercio de todo tipo en especial a vender zapatillas de cuero y cuerina que fabrican en su propia casa. Ella junto con sus compañeras realiza constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cueros y cuerinas, con las cuales hace las zapatillas que vende, ya que de ese modo podrá seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Th women of the San Antonio II committee are very hardworking people.  They are very grateful to the Fundación because thanks to the loans, they can invest in their businesses and for others, begin their commercial activity.

The president, Gabina, lives with her husband and children.  She has worked in all types of commerce, and especially in selling sandals made of leather and imitation leather, which she makes in her own home.  Along with her co-workers, she participates regularly in activites, promoting the integration of the group members and trying to advance their payments.

She is requesting this loan to purchase leather and imitation leather, with which she makes the sandals that she sells, since in the way she will be able to continue working and investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase leather and imitation leather for making sandals.

loans.name: Laura Esther

texts.es:
Laura es una joven de 20 años que convive con su pareja, el cual es estibador. Actualmente ambos viven en la ciudad de Ica,Perú, lugar caracterizado por desarrollo económico que se ha realizado en los últimos años, es aquí en donde ha surgido gran cantidad y variedad de microempresarios debido a la demanda y exigencias de los nuevos clientes iqueños.

Laura es una joven que tiene una pequeña bodega, ella se dedica en promedio 11 horas diarias, tiempo en el que atiende a un promedio de 20 clientes diarios, ella está segura que la afluencia de clientes que tiene se ha ido incrementando debido a los bajos precios que ofrece en la zona en donde vende.

Actualmente sus clientes están demandando nuevos productos y en algunas ocasiones ella no puede vendérselos porque no cuenta con lo que ellos necesitan es por esto que Laura desea realizar la compra de una refrigeradora con la finalidad de vender gaseosas y otro tipo de bebidas heladas, también desea poder comprar algunos andamios para exhibir de mejor manera su productos.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá realizar la mejora de sus ingresos debido a que con esta inversión logrará tener mayor acogida por sus clientes. Lo mismo que contribuirá a que cumpla su gran sueño “Tener una bodega repleta y construir su propia casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Laura, 20, lives with her spouse who is a stevedore.  They both live in the city of Ica, Perú, a place noted for the economic development it’s had in the last few years.  A large number and variety of micro businesses have arisen here due to demand and requests from new customers in Ica.

Laura is a young woman who has a small store where she spends on average 11 hours daily taking care of an average of 20 customers daily.  She’s sure that the affluence of customers she’s had is due to the low prices she offers in the zone where she sells.

Her customers are currently demanding new products and sometimes she’s unable to sell them because she doesn’t have what they need and this is why Laura wants to buy a refrigerator in order to sell soft-drinks and other types of cold beverages; she also wants to buy some shelves in order to better display her wares.

With help from Kiva lenders she will be able to improve her income because with this new investment she will be better received by her customers which will contribute to her being able to reach her great dream: “To have a well-stocked store and to build her own house out of substantial materials.”

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and shelving.

loans.name: Jhonatan Alberto

texts.es:
Jhonatan Alberto es un joven de apenas 20 años que con apoyo de su madre y gracias a su actitud ya es un microempresario, hasta hace unos meses el se encontraba estudiando enfermería, pero debido a que su madre no contaba con los ingresos suficientes para poder ayudarlo a continuar estudiando, el decidió dedicarse a brindar el servicio de transporte en una moto taxi.

Actualmente el trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias, decidió dedicarse a este tipo de negocio porque sabía que en la zona en donde vive hay mucha demanda de este servicio y también las distancias de traslado son cortas.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, desea poder pagar algunas cuotas para culminar sus estudios y también comprar parlantes para la moto taxi. El sabe que con esta nueva motivación el podrá mejorar y crecer como profesional, desea convertirse en enfermero y así mejorar su calidad de vida, como parte de ello desea comprar una computadora y su gran sueño es “Culminar sus estudios”.
texts.en:
Jhonatan Alberto, 20, is a young man who with help from his mother and thanks to his attitude is already a micro businessman.  Until a few months ago he was studying nursing but because his mother did not have sufficient income to help him continue in school, he decided to provide transportation service with a mototaxi.

He currently works an average of 10 hours daily.  He decided to go into this business because he knew that in the zone where he lives demand for this service is high and distances to cover are short.

With help from Kiva lenders he wants to pay fees to finish his studies and also to buy speakers for his mototaxi.  He knows that with this new motivation he will be able to improve and grow as a professional; he wants to become a nurse to improve his quality of life and as part of this he wants to buy a computer and his great dream is to “Finish his studies.”

loans.use: to pay school fees and to buy speakers.

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es: La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos secos como trigo,moraya,maiz y cebada,ella vende en el mercado desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos secos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos como sacos de trigo,cebada y maiz.
texts.en: Antolina continues working at her business, selling dry goods such as wheat, corn, and barley.  She sells in the market from 6:00 a.m until 5:00 p.m.  Through this business, she helps her children get ahead.  Her dream is to expand her dry goods business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase dry grains such as sacks of wheat, barley, and corn.

loans.use: to purchase dry grains such as sacks of wheat, barley, and corn.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa est éleveur depuis 2009. Il vient récemment de démarrer cette activité et voudrait avoir l’appui de l’Institution pour améliorer  son commerce. Il est à son 1èr prêt et sollicite un montant de 300000F CFA pour acheter de jeunes vaches, les élever puis les revendre.
Moussa est marié et père de 5 enfants dont le plus jeune a 7 ans et l’ainé, 22 ans. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne  et a comme projet futur de payer les études de son fils bachelier.
texts.en:
Moussa has been raising livestock since 2009.  He has recently started working in this activity and would like the support of the institution in improving his business.  This is his first loan and he is requesting 300,000 CFA in order to buy some calves to raise and then re-sell.

Moussa is married and has five children.  His youngest is 7 years old and his eldest is 22.  He takes care of his family's daily expenses and his future plans are to pay for his son's baccalaureate studies.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise and then re-sell

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgé(e) de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un pasteur. Elle a 02 enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a 14 ans et le dernier a 11 ans.  
Adjo travaille comme revendeuse de condiments et des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2005. Elle vend à la boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Adjo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale (riz, sucre, huile végétale…). Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo voudrait augmenter le stock. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit offrir une meilleure éducation aux enfants.
texts.en:
Adjo is a 49-year-old woman.  She is married to a pastor.  She has two children, age 14 and 11, who both attend school.

She has been reselling condiments and general food products since 2005.  She stocks up in Lomé and sells in a shop.

She has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy general food products such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil etc.  She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Adjo would like to increase her stock of merchandise.  She says that with the profits, she plans to offer a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy condiments and food products.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Madeleine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un certain Thomas. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Madeleine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Madeleine vend des tissus dans un marché du Benin. Madeleine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Madeleine et les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leurs activités et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: 'Dieu est Grand' is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative is Madeleine (who is raising her hand in the photo).  She is 47 years old and married to Thomas.  The couple have three children who are all in school and in their care.  Madeleine lives together with her children and her husband and both she and her husband take care of their household expenses.  Madeleine has been selling fabrics in a market in Benin for nearly 15 years.  She gets her supplies from another market in Benin.  This is the second time that Madeleine and the other members of the 'Dieu est Grand' group have requested a loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital, improve their businesses and better respond to their customers' demands.  Their first loan was repaid according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: La Confianza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Luz is part of the group “La Confianza” (Confidence) along with 14 other members. All of them sell products and merchandise either as street vendors or from their homes. Luz joined Esperanza International because she needed capital for her business.

Luz is very excited about receiving her third loan from Esperanza International. She manages a sewing business where she makes clothes, school uniforms, and decorations. She will invest this loan to purchase fabrics and accessories used in making a few of the products that she sells. Her profits will be reinvested in her business and a portion saved because she wants to expand her sales and open a clothing store.

Luz lives with her husband in one of the poorest neighborhoods located in the north of Santo Domingo. She thanks all of you for supporting her group!!!

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Mahouvivi 3 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUVIVI 3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, Séraphine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Jonas. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Séraphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Séraphine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de cinq ans, Séraphine vend du pain et de haricot de façon ambulante. Séraphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la quatrième fois que Séraphine et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUVIVI 3 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
"MAHOUVIVI 3" is a group of three persons whose members live in the same house. The group's representative, Séraphine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 27 years old and married to a mechanic by the name of Jonas. They have three children, all in school and in their care. 

Séraphine did not attend school. She lives together with her children and husband and jointly ensures that the different household expenses are covered. For five years, Séraphine has been selling bread and beans by going door to door. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. 

This is the fourth time that Séraphine and the other members of the group MAHOUVIVI 3 have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and their work and responding better to the requirements of their customers. The loans received previously have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy beans and some condiments

loans.name: Esperanza De Dios 5 Group

texts.en:
Clomena is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza de Dios (God's Hope) 5, composed of five Haitians who are living in a batey near the city of La Romana, an area where the economy is dominated by sugar cane, and where running water (none of it potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner. Their children are grown and living in Haiti.

Clomena is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small food stand by purchasing vegetables, meat, charcoal, and fruit. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to cover their needs. She also helps her children and family by sending money to them when they need it. Clomena thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, charcoal, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall. Marina has been in this business for 10 years. Marina earns more income from a variety store.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Esther 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the group coordinator of Esther 1, 3, & 4, which is made up of 15 micro-entrepreneurs. This group is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, in one of the rural villages surrounding the main city. Margarita enjoys working and being at her home with her family. She lives with her long-term partner and their three children. She said that her most difficult challenge is to improve her business. She dreams of having a successful business and to bring change to her family.

Margarita operates a business selling miscellaneous items like cosmetics, shoes, and clothes. She will use the loan to purchase dozens of these items to increase her business inventory. She is excited to receive her 11th loan with Esperanza Internacional, as with each loan she has been able to invest in her business and improve it, making it possible to provide for her family's needs. She thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (shoes, cosmetics, and clothes)

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en: This time, Melisa is borrowing 18,000 Philippine pesos to fund her coconut-farming business. The hog-raising business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Melisa and her family additional capital for building and expanding her business operations.

loans.use: to buy tools for her coconut farm and pay for labor

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 5ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
	

Trabalha como operaria num estaleiro privado ÚNICA há mais de 2 anos e tem um salário de 3.000.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar bens de consumo para mobilar a sua casa (mesa, geleira, cadeiras, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.300.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 22.500.00mt,aplicados no negócio e bens de consumo. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Maputo, province of the same name, southern Mozambique. She's married and has four children, all of which attend school. She completed 5th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her famiy in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has worked as a laborer for the ÚNICA private shipyard for over two years. She earns a salary of 3.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her 4th loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase consumer goods to furnish her home (table, refrigerator, chairs, etc.). The previous loans were for 6.300mt, 10.000mt and 22.500mt and they were used for her business and for consumer goods.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to enlarge her house in order to provide more comfort for her family. For that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase consumer goods to furnish her home (table, refrigerator, chairs, etc.).

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.ru: Каныкей 47 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Каныкей  17 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 10,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Каныкей, ее поголовье насчитывает  5 дойных коров, 20 овец, 2 козы и 3 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Каныкей обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Каныкей планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Kanykei is 47 years old, married and has four children. As a source of income for her family Kanykei has started doing animal husbandry seventeen years ago. The business was started with 10,000 som (KGS) now brings around 5,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk and meat products. Through hard work Kanykei's business now has five milk cows, twenty sheep, two goats and three horses. With the purpose to further grow her business Kanykei has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som to buy livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of headcount of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Judite

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez o ensino superior e parou por falta de tempo para continuar com os estudos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
	

É professora e negociante há mais de 28 anos na Escola Joaquim Chissano e tem um salário de 18.600.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Já teve empréstimo no BIM e pagou sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, amendoim, arroz, açúcar, refrescos, sumos, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 15.000.00mt, 24.000.00mt, 30.000.00mt, 40.000.00mt, e 50.000.00mt,aplicados no negócio e habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir uma Escola privada, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Matola, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's single and has two children, all of which attend school. She went to college and stopped due to lack of time for continuing her studies. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman and a teacher at the Joaquim Chissano school for over 28 years. She earns a salary of 18.600mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had a loan with BIM and has repaid it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her 6th loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (oil, peanuts, rice, sugar, refreshments, juice, etc.) in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise. The previous loans were for 15.000mt, 24.000mt, 30.000mt, 40.000mt and 50.000mt, and they were used for her business and for housing expenses.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to build a private school and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (oil, peanuts, rice, sugar, refreshments, juice, etc.).

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 43 года, замужем, имеет 6 детей, младшей из которых 5 лет.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Динара  в 1995 году начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 5,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Динары, доходы от хозяйства позволяют оплачивать учебу для детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Dinara is 43 years old, married and has six children the youngest of whom is five years old. As a source of income for her family Dinara started doing animal husbandry in 1995. The business started with 5,000 som (KGS) now brings around 7,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk and meat products. Through Dinara's hard work the income from the business allows to pay for her children's education. With the purpose to further grow her business Dinara has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som to buy livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of headcount of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane , Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos todos maiores de idade. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ele. 
	

É negociante há mais de 10 anos e dedica-se a compra e revenda de produtos alimentares e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Já teve empréstimo no BIM e pagou sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, amendoim, arroz, farinha, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, aplicados no negócio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir uma mercearia maior para diversificar mais os seus produtos, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's married and has three adult children. She completed 6th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two grandchildren who live with her.
She has been a businesswoman for over 10 years. She buys and sells foodstuffs and earns an income of about 4.500mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had a loan with BIM and has repaid it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (oil, peanuts, rice, flour, etc.) in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise. The previous loans were for 15.000mt and 20.000mt, for her business.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to build a larger grocery store in order to diversify her merchandise. For that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (oil, peanuts, rice, flour, etc.).

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en: This time Gorgonia is borrowing 11,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to fund her livestock business. This business, previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF, continues to provide her and her family the ability to increase their income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and livestock feed.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane , Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e não tem filhos. Fez o nível médio e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 irmãos e 1 sobrinho que vivem com ela. 
	

Trabalha como técnica agro-pecuária há mais de 3 meses e tem um salário de 4.000.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 24.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro, blocos, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt, aplicado na habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's married and doesn't have children. She went to high school and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two siblings and a nephew who live with her.
She has worked as an agricultural technician for over three months and earns a salary of 4.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 24.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build her house (sand, cement, rocks, iron, bricks, etc). The previous loan was for 10.000mt, for housing expenses.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish building and furnishing her home, and for that purpose she plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to build her home (sand, cement, rocks, iron, bricks, etc.).

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Belen requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. 

She has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Belen would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 58 years old and married with two children. 

Delma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell at her store. 

Delma has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising livestock. 

Delma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell at her store.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is married with 6 children, 2 of whom are in school. She is 47 years old and is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emelita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Emelita has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Emelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez o nível médio e parou por falta de tempo de continuar com os estudos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a mãe enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares. 
	

Trabalha como técnica administrativa há mais de 7 anos e tem um salário de 5.700.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Já teve empréstimo no BIM e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro, blocos, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt, e 16.000.00mt, aplicado na habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e comprar uma viatura, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Julieta was born in Matola, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 3 children who all attend school.  She attended secondary school but didn't finish because she did not have time to continue her studies.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she also supports her mother by sending her money to help with food expenses.  

Julieta has worked as an administrative assistant for over 7 years and has a salary of 5.700.00mt, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).  

She previously had a loan with BIM and was able to make payments without any problems.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials for her home (sand, cement, stones, iron, blocks, etc.)  The prior loans were for 10.000.00mt and 16.000.00mt, also for her house.

She promises to make her payments on schedule. In the future she plans to finish her house and purchase a car.  She intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku for these purposes.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her home (sand, cement, stones, iron, blocks, etc.)

loans.name: Guljamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал 34 года, вдова, имеет 3 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Гулжамал начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжамал,  ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 коровы, 7 овец, также доходы от хозяйства позволяют Гулжамал строить дом для своей семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулжамал обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Гулжамал  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес – деятельности за счет засева хлопка.
texts.en: Guljamal is 34 years old, she is a widow and has three children. As a source of income for her family Guljamal has started doing animal husbandry. The business started with 20,000 som (KGS) now brings around 15,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk and meat products. Through hard work Guljamal's business now has two cows, seven sheep, as well as the income which allows her to build a house for her family. With the purpose to further grow her business Guljamal has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som to buy livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan to further expand her business activity by cultivating cotton.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Жамиле 39 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Жамила начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 5,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 3,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. На сегодня,  ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 коровы и в целях увеличения поголовья, Жамила обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Жамила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес – деятельности за счет засева зерновых культур.
texts.en: Jamila is 39 years old, she is married and has four children. As a source of income for her family Jamila started doing animal husbandry. The business started with 5,000 som (KGS) now brings around 3,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk and meat products. Today Jamila's business has two cows and with the purpose to further grow her business Jamila has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som to buy livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan to further expand her business activity by cultivating cereals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urquillos, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Hermelinda tiene  60 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo la socia  se dedica a la artesanía la socia realiza diversos trabajos como pantalones, chompas, porta agua, entre otros tejidos los cuales lleva  a las diferentes ferias a vender, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea seguir prosperando, ella en esta ocasión desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de lanas, hilos de colores, agujas, lanas de alpaca, lanas ade oveja, lanas sintéticas, para seguir tejiendo y poder llevar a vender en las ferias.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en: The member belongs to the Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos Communal Bank, located in the district of Urquillos, province of Calca, department of Cusco.  Hermelinda is 60 years old, married, and has one son.  She is an artisan who creates various crafts such as pants, sweaters, water bottle holders, and other weavings that she sells at various markets.  She is a hard-working woman who wishes to continue prospering.  At this time, she is requesting the loan to purchase wool, colored thread, needles, alpaca wool, sheep wool, and synthetic wool in order to continue weaving crafts to sell at the markets.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wool, colored thread, needles, alpaca wool, sheep wool, and synthetic wool in order to continue weaving crafts to sell at the markets.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: This time, for her 19th cycle loan, Fe is borrowing PHP 20,000 to fund her food production business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva, and it continues to provide Fe and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Kuña Ñembyaty Mba´apora Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Ñembyaty Mba´apora Rekavo”; es un grupo de mujeres indigenas del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.  Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con diez integrantes, donde todas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y por sobre todo trabajadoras.
Clementina es una de las integrantes, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser pollos, cerdos, cabras y demás tipos, con lo cual y por medio de su arduo trabajo ayuda a su familia día a día. Ella nos comenta que su trabajo es un poco sacrificado, ya que siempre debe de estar pendiente de sus animales para que nos les pase nada.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos y cerdos pequeños para la cría, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Ñembyaty Mba´apora Rekavo” committee is a group of indigenous women in the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Women Entrepreneurs) program of the Fundación Paraguaya.  They are currently in their first loan cycle.  The group has 10 members and all are very self-sacrificing and, above all, hardworking women.  

Clementina is one of the members of this group.  She has a business raising and selling animals such as chickens, pigs, goats, and others, which enables her, through her hard work, to help out her family each day.  She tells us that her work is a little demanding, since she always needs to keep an eye on her animals to ensure that nothing happens to them.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks and piglets to raise.  This will allow her to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and piglets that she will raise.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos uma frequenta a Escola. Fez a setima classe e parou por falta de tempo de continuar com os estudos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a mãe enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares. 
	

Trabalha a conta propira fazendo negocio ha mais de 6 anos e consegue render cerca de cinco mil meticais mensalmente.

 Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro, blocos, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de  12.000.00mt aplicado na habitação, construcao da sua moradia. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e comprar uma viatura, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Margarida was born in the city of Matola, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 2 children who attend school.  She completed school through the 7th grade, but dropped out because she did not have time to continue her studies.  She owns the family where she lives with her family and also supports her mother by sending her money to help with food expenses.  

She has worked as a self-employed business woman for over 6 years and she earns around 5.000.00mt per month.  	

This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials for her home (sand, cement, stones, iron, blocks, etc.)  Her prior loan was for 12.000.00mt,  also for home construction. 

She promises to make her payments on schedule. In the future she plans to finish her house and purchase a car.  She intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku for these purposes.

loans.use: to purchase materials for constuction on her home (sand, cement, stones, iron, blocks, etc.)

loans.name: Zattar

texts.ru: Заттар  53 года, вдова, мать 9 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Заттар  10 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 10,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Заттар, ее поголовье насчитывает  3 дойных коров, 10 овец, 1 бычка и 2 лошадей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Заттар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Заттар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем – купить дом в городе.
texts.en: Zattar is 53 years old, she is a widow and a mother of nine children. As a source of income for her family Zattar started doing animal husbandry ten years ago. The business started with 10,000 som (KGS) now brings around 10,000 KGS a month from the sale of dairy and meat products. Through hard work Zattar's business has three milk cows, ten sheep, one calf and two horses. With the purpose to further grow her business Zattar has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som to buy calves for fattening and resale. She plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase of the headcount of cattle and in the future to buy a house in the city.

loans.use: to purchase calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Onelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais apenas um frequenta a Escola outros não tem idade Escolar. Fez a 12ª classe e se formou como professora no IFP da MUNHUANA, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
	

É professora há mais de 4 anos e tem um salário de 4.300.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BCI).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro, blocos, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt, aplicado na habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's married and has three children - only one of them attends school, the others are below school age. She completed 12th grade and graduated as a teacher from IFP at MUNHUANA. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a teacher for over four years and earns a salary of 4.300mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 20.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build her house (sand, cement, rocks, iron, bricks, etc). The previous loan was for 15.000mt, for housing expenses.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish building her home, and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to build her home (sand, cement, rocks, iron, bricks, etc.).

loans.name: Salkynai

texts.ru: Салкынай 36 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Салкынай начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с одной коровы, полученной в качестве подарка на свадьбу,  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. На сегодня,  ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 коровы, 30 овец и 1 лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Салкынай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 27 голов овец. Доходы Салкынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес – деятельности за счет торговли продуктами питания.
texts.en: Salkynai is 36 years old, she is married and has five children. As a source of income for her family Salkynai started doing animal husbandry. The business started with one cow received as a wedding gift now brings around 5,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk and meat products. Today Salkynai's business has two cows, 30 sheep and one horse. With the purpose to further grow her business Salkynai has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som to buy 27 heads of sheep. She plans to invest the income from the loan to further expand her business activity by selling food products.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 43 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Элмира 10 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Элмиры, ее поголовье насчитывает 2 дойной коровы, 15 овец, 3 козы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы и теленка. Доходы Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и расширение сарая для скота.
texts.en: Elmira is 43 years old, she is married and has four children. As a source of income for her family Elmira started doing animal husbandry ten years ago. The business started with 20,000 som (KGS) now brings around 8,000 KGS a month from the sale of dairy and meat products. Through hard work Elmira's business has two milk cows, fifteen sheep and three goats. With the purpose to further grow her business Elmira has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som to buy a milk cow and a calf. She plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase of the headcount of cattle and to expand the shed space for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and a calf.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
“Medalla Milagrosa “fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en el 3°ciclo con 16 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras. Ellas se dedican diversas actividades, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto, para que de esa forma puedan ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La señora Ma. Angelica es una de las miembros, y nos comenta que se unió al grupo con mucha esperanza de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y dice que tiene muy buena clientela siempre, lo que la ayuda a tener buenos ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de otoño, pues ya se acerca la estación y quiere surtir su stock. Está agradecida a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Medalla Milagrosa Committee is currently in its third loan cycle.  The group is comprised of sixteen responsible and hard-working women.  They are engaged in various activities but they also participate in activities together in order to support each other.  

Angelica is one of the members, and she tells us that she joined this group with high hopes of getting ahead so that she would be able to support her family and provide them with their daily needs. Angelica sells all types of clothing and says that she has always has good customers, and this enables her to earn good income.

She is requesting this loan to purchase fall clothing as this season is approaching and she wishes to stock her business.  She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for the support that she is receiving

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Fabiola  tiene 26 años no es casada pero es madre soltera tiene un hijo que es de la edad de 4 años, se dedica a la venta de  comida ella vive por la zona de Pentaguazu, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, Fabiola  utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio ya que incremento su clientela y necesita darles comodidad a sus clientela, también la razón para solicitar este préstamo es hacer crecer el negocio. Fabiola  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la competencia en el mercado ya que la venta de comida se realiza por todos lados y utilizara los beneficios compra de enseres para el negocio, el deseo de la Sra. Fabiola  es poder comprarse un terreno, La Sra. Fabiola es una persona joven y trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Fabiola, 26, is not married and is a single mother to a four year old son. She lives in the zone of Pentaguazu and works selling food. This is her second loan with the institution, and she will use it to buy tables and chairs for her business because her clientele has increased and she needs to give them more comfort. She also asked for a loan to help her business grow. Fabiola faces challenges like competition in the market, because people are selling food all over the place, and she will use the profits to buy materials for the business. Her wish is to be able to buy some land. Fabiola is young and hardworking, and she's happy and grateful to the institution for the support they've given her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Bumaira

texts.ru: Бумайре 41 год, замужем, имеет 4 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Бумайра 10 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,500 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Бумайры, ее поголовье насчитывает 10 голов крупного рогатого скота, 10 овец, 1 лошадь. Также, Бумайра обрабатывает 2,0 га собственной орошаемой земли , где выращивает фасоль и 1,0 га арендованной с картофелем. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бумайра обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма, закуп селитры для удобрения земли и семян элитного картофеля. Доходы Бумайра планирует вложить в расширение сарая для скота и внешней отделки жилого дома.
texts.en: Bumaira is 41 years old, she is married and has four children. As a source of income for her family Bumaira started doing animal husbandry ten years ago. The business started with 20,000 som (KGS) now brings around 5,500 KGS a month from the sale of dairy and meat products. Through hard work Bumaira's business has ten heads of large horned cattle, ten sheep and one horse. Also Bumaira cultivates 2,0 hectares of her own arable land where she grows beans and 1,0 hectare of rented land with potatoes. With the purpose to further grow her business Bumaira has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som to buy two calves for fattening, ammonium nitrate to fertilize the land and seeds of premium potatoes. She plans to invest the income from the loan to expand the shed space for the cattle and to do cosmetic repairs of inside of her house.

loans.use: to purchase calves, potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Noudonangnon Group

texts.fr: NOUDONANGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Gilberte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un certain Alexandre. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Gilberte n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Gilberte vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de vingt cinq ans, Gilberte  vend de maïs, du charbon de bois et du sucre dans sa région au Benin. Gilberte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin.  C’est la troisième fois que Gilberte et les autres membres du groupe NOUDONANGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Noudonangnon group  includes three individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Gilberte (raising her hand in the photo) is 47 years old. Her husband's name is Alexandre. They have four dependent children, all in school. Gilberte did not attend school. Gilberte lives together with her husband and children and together with her husband provides for various family needs. For about 25 years, Gilbert has been selling corn, charcoal and sugar in her region of Benin. Giberte stocks up at one of Benin's markets. Gilberte and the other members of the Noudonangnon group are seeking their third loan from ALIDe in order to bolster their working capital and their business, and better respond to customer demand. Their prior loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and charcoal.

loans.name: Las Pedrozeñas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son  de la ciudad de  Caacupé, se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto, ya en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas son todas amigas y vecinas del barrio y son destacadas por su trabajo en conjunto y ayuda entre ellas.
Cynthia se dedica a la venta de joyas, y comenta que vende todo tipo de ellas, como ser cadenas, anillos, pulseras, aros y demás. Tiene una buena cantidad de clientes, ya que tiene buen precio y forma accesible para pagar. Comenta que empezó de a poco, pero que después de mucho esfuerzo ha logrado ir creciendo y salir adelante. Su meta es seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de joyas, con lo cual puede tener siempre buena variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women of Las Pedrozeñas Group are from the city of Caacupé.  They are working comfortably, already in the second cycle of Fundación Paraguaya’s women entrepreneurs program.  They are all friends and neighbors from the barrio and are known for working together and helping each other.  

Cynthia sells all types of jewelry including chains, rings, bracelets, hoops, and other items.  She has a good number of customers as she offers good prices and convenient payment options.  She says that she began with very little, but after much hard work, she grew the business and got ahead.  Her goal is to continue working and helping her family.  She is requesting the loan to purchase jewelry so that she will always have a wide variety of goods to offer her customers

loans.use: to purchase goods for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujer Unidas"se originó a traves de promociones realizadas en el barrio. Todas las mujeres son de la misma zona. El objetivo del grupo es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa por medio del trabajo de todas ellas.
La sra. Aurora es la  Presidenta del grupo, ella Trabaja en la cría y venta de pollos y cerdos. Su deseo es que su grupo se fortalezca y que juntas puedan seguir trabajando por el bienestar del mismo.  En cuanto a su trabajo nos dice que le va bien, ya que tiene clientes fijos que compran de ella los animales que cría.
En miras a seguir trabajando solicita el crédito, para que pueda comprar balanceados para sus animales, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee "Mujeres Unidas" started because of advertisements in the neighborhood where all of the women live. The group's goal is to work, encourage a spirit of solidarity, and to reach the highest level of the program through all of their efforts.

Aurora is the president of the group. She raises and sells chickens and pigs. She wants her group to become strong so that together they can keep working for their own well-being. She tells us that her work goes well because she has fixed clientele that buy the animals that she raises.

In view of continuing her work, she asks for a loan to buy balanced feed for her animals, which will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for the animals.

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
El Sr. Remigio tiene 45 años de edad, esta acompañado con la señora Mercedes de 51 años de edad, ellos tiene 3 hijos, los tres están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
Don Remigio se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa bien surtida,  hace  aproximadamente 6 años que se dedica a esto, por lo que ya tiene una buena clientela y un poco de experiencia en el ramo. Comenzó con el capital que ahorraba prestando servicios de taxi, en un primer momento abrieron su negocio con su esposa a la par que el seguía con su trabajo.
Solicita este préstamo para comprar artículos de primera necesidad para abastecer su despensa, como ser comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás. El agradece la oportunidad de progreso que recibe y dice que no defraudara la confianza.
texts.en:
Remigio is 45 years old; he is accompanied by Mercedes, age 51, and they have three children. All three attend high school. 

Remigio is in sales. He has a small grocery store which is well stocked. It's been about six years since he got into this business, so he has a good customer base and a little experience in the industry. He started with capital that he had saved offering taxi services, and at the first opportunity he opened his business with his wife. At the same time he continued with his work. 

He's requesting this loan to buy basic necessity items to stock his store, such as foodstuffs, drinks, and dairy products, among other things. He appreciates the confidence and opportunity to get ahead that he's received, and he says that he won't disappoint.

loans.use: to buy goods, such as food, drinks and dairy products, for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Gaudencia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Gaudencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Antonia tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos en edad escolar, por quienes ella siempre lucha. Esta señora es muy emprendedora y trabajadora, se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de ropa de hilo que ella misma fabrica con su máquina y otros productos, pero también aparte de eso tiene una pequeña despensa.
Gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerle estudiar, para que ellos no tengan que pasar por ninguna privación como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer más ropas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe, pues le será muy provechosa.
texts.en: Señora Antonia is 30-years-old and is a single mother of 3 school-aged children for whom she always fights.  She is very enterprising and hard-working.  She makes and sells clothing and other products made out of yarn that she herself makes with her machine.  She also has a small grocery store.  Thanks to her work and effort, she can provide her children with everything they need and also keep them in school, so they don't have to suffer any hardship like she had to.  She is requesting this loan to buy yarn and dye to weave more clothing because she has a lot of requests from her customers this season.  She is thankful for the help she is receiving.  It will be very beneficial to her.

loans.use: To buy yarn and dye to be able to weave.

loans.name: Citas

texts.en:
Citas is 57 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Citas runs a beauty-products retail business in the Philippines.  She has requested a loan of PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell.

Citas has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, lotion, perfume, etc. 

In the future, Citas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 38 years old, married and has seven children. He is from Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Julie owns and operates a nipa-making business (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials).  He has been in his business for 4 years and earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Julie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Julie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité de  Mujeres Kuña Katupyry  cuenta con16 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por  más pequeña que sea. las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias, utilizando todos sus recursos disponibles hace que sus luchas su mayor fortaleza.
Deysi es una mujer que se desvive por su familia, ellos son quienes la inspiran a seguir luchando para poder alcanzar sus metas. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, y nos cuenta que este ha sido su medio de trabajo hace ya un tiempo. Gracias a esto ayuda en la casa y a su familia y desea poder seguir mucho tiempo mas.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en prendas, las cuales quiere vender y asi seguir trabajando. Su meta es tener una tienda donde poder ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes
texts.en:
The women's group Kuña Katupyry has 16 members; each has a small business to which she is dedicated, no matter how small.  The ladies feel very excited.  The mutual help between them is constant and above all, they inspire each other to continue fighting for their families, using all the available resources; this makes their resolve their greatest strength.  

Deysi is a woman who is devoted to her family; they are the ones who inspire her to continue fighting to be able to reach her goals.  She works selling all types of clothing and tells us that this has been her job for quite awhile.  Thanks to this help in the home and her family, she desires to be able to continue for much longer.  Her goal is to have a store where she could offer her products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio es casado, tiene una hija y vive en la ciudad de Luque. El nos cuenta que tiene una empresa serigrafía ya hace más de 20 años. Dicha empresa se especializa para la pintura de las telas para los atuendos deportivos de los clubes de la Liga Paraguaya de futbol.
En su negocio lo ayuda su esposa y su hija en el aérea de administración. El comenta que toda su familia esta unida en el trabajo, lo que lo motiva más para seguir adelante y luchar por ellos día a día.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de pinturas y laminas de cartones para impresiones de camisetas, los cuales son los elementos que el utiliza para poder trabajar. Comenta que le dará un mejor margen de ganancia y asi tener un poco mas de ingresos.
texts.en:
Antonio is married, has one daughter, and lives in the city of Luque. He tells us that he has had a silk screen printing business for more than 20 years. Said business specializes in printing the cloth for athletic uniforms used by clubs in the Paraguayan Soccer Association. 

In his business he's assisted by his wife and daughter in the administration area. He says that all of his family is united in the work, which is what motivates him even more to get ahead and work for them every day. 

He is requesting a loan to buy paint and sheets of cardboard for printing t-shirts, which are elements of his work. He says that it will give him a better profit margin, so he will have a little better income.

loans.use: to buy paint and sheets of cardboard for printing t-shirts.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is married, 57 years of age, and lives in Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with her 10 children. Matilde is operating a home products buy-and-sell business to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years and she earns 3,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more products such as lotion, lipsticks and many others. 

Matilde's business is very stable in her community. She joined GDMPC last year. In the future, Matilde will use her income to support her children in their studies until they finish college and also to support their daily needs. Matilde wishes that her business will become more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as lotion, lipsticks and many others

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La  Sra. Lida es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Andres de  38 años de edad. Juntos tienen 1 Hijo, aun pequeño.
La Sra. Lida tiene una Despensa en su casa, y nos comenta que está bien surtida, y es por eso que tiene muy buena clientela. Es una señora muy trabajadora, excelente cliente con fundación paraguaya y con otras entidades financieras. Comenta que su meta es seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a su marido con la manutención de la casa para poder darle un buen futuro a su hijo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas, productos a granel y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de fundación paraguaya y de kiva.
texts.en:
Lida is from the city of Santaní. She is 30 years old, and married to Andres, 38. They have a small son.

Lida has a small grocery store in her home which she says is well stocked, and that is why she has a very good customer base. She is a very hardworking lady, and is an excellent client of Fundación Paraguaya and other financial institutions. She says her goal is to continue growing her business and thus help her husband with maintenance of their house and to give a good future for their child.

Lida is requesting a loan to buy groceries, beverages, vegetables, and other wholesale products. She is thankful for the help she is receiving from Paraguayan Foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her store.

loans.name: Marilin Jimena

texts.es: La Sra. Marilin Tiene 35 años no es casada pero es madre soltera con 2 hijos que son de 4, 2, 3 y 9 años,  Ella se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza por catalogo,  Este préstamo es la cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Marilin utilizara este préstamo para la compra de  cosméticos por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción por esta  razón solicita este préstamo para  aumento de capital y mejorar sus ingresos económicos,  Marilin  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia y  utilizara los beneficios para la compra de algunos artefactos para su casa, la Sra. Marilin es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Marilin is 35 years old and is a single mother of 4 children who are 4, 2, 3 and 9 years old.  She earns a living selling cosmetics and beauty products from a catalog.  This loan is the fourth she will be requesting through this institution, and Marilin will use the loan in order to purchase cosmetics at wholesale prices and those that are on sale.  She is asking for this loan in order to increase her capital and to improver her economic earnings.  Marilin faces challenges in her business, such as competition, and she will use the profit she receives to purchase some things for her home.  Marilin is a very hard-working person and she is happy and thankful to this institution for the support that it offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cosmetics.

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
El señor Milciades Pereira es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 32 años, está acompañado con la señora Mirian, tienen dos hijas pequeñas quienes aun van a la escuela.
El sr Milciades tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, pero también aparte de eso tiene otro trabajo en una empresa donde es chofer hace más de 5 años. Es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
 Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, bebidas, fideos, arroz, etc., con lo cual podrá abastecer su local. El señor está muy agradecido con la fundación por que gracias a  eso agrando un poco mas su negocio, y fue mejorando la forma de vida  de  él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Milciades Pereira, 32, is from the city of Concepcion. He has a partner, Miram, and they have two young daughters who attend school.

Milciades has a well-stocked grocery store at home, but beyond that he also has another job as a driver for a company, which he has done for over 5 years. He is a hard worker, and above all he is eager to succeed and help his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy meat, drinks, noodles, rice, etc, to supply his store. Milciades is very grateful to the foundation, and it is thanks to them that he has been able to grow his business a little, and has been improving the lifestyle for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his store.

loans.name: Victoria Ruth

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria tiene 68 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  35 y 27 años,  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, visitando casas y domicilios, Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Victoria utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de diferentes modelos de ropa para vender, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumento de inventario,  Victoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de las ventas de las mañaneras, Ella utilizara los beneficios llegando de a poco  tener una tienda propia y con el tiempo  sueña en administrar su propia tienda, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Victoria is 68 years old and married with two children (ages 35 and 27). She works as a mobile vendor by visiting houses and residences selling clothing. 

This loan will be her first with the institution; she will use the loan to buy different styles of clothing to sell. The reason for requesting the loan is to increase her inventory. 

Victoria faces challenges in her business - one being competition from early morning street vendors. She will use the gradually accumulating benefits to have her own store and she hopes that with time she will run her own store. She feels very appreciative to the institution for the support they've offered.

loans.use: to buy different styles of clothing.

loans.name: Tolentina

texts.en:
Tolentina is married with 6 children. Tolentina is 50 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Tolentina sells charcoal to earn a living.  She has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase coconut shell for her coco-charcoal business.

Tolentina has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Tolentina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shell for her coco-charcoal business

loans.name: Emlyn

texts.en: Emlyn is a married woman with six children. Emlyn is 45 years old and she resides at Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte in the Philippines. Emlyn owns and operates a fishing business, selling seafood products to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Emlyn has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Emlyn hopes to support her children in completing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 43 years old and lives in San Juan, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child.
 
Lucena has a sari-sari (variety) store business and earns approximately 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for additional groceries and consumable goods for her business. 

Lucena has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Lucena hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: To pay for additional groceries and consumable goods.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 44 años está al frente de una zapatería que es propia. El señor vive en casa de sus padres que ya son de edad muy avanzada y el los cuida.
Oscar nos cuenta que para él la vida fue muy difícil ya que tiene un impedimento físico en sus piernas lo cual le dificulta bastante caminar y desenvolverse normalmente, cuando niño le ayudaba a su padre en la zapatería y  a poco fue aprendiendo a hacer los zapatos ya que era un trabajo que no requeria de muchos movimientos de las piernas, más bien se pasaba más tiempo sentado trabajando, fue por eso que se especializo en fabricación y compostura de zapatos y hasta ahora tiene muchos clientes, y es un negocio bastante bueno y rentable.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cueros, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando, ya sea haciendo zapatos o componiéndolos. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que le están dando de salir adelante y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
44-year-old Oscar is from the city of Concepción, and manages his own shoe store. He lives with his parents, who are very old and he looks after them.
Oscar tells us that life for him has been very difficult because he has a physical disability in his legs, which makes it hard to walk and function normally. 

As a child helped his father in the shoe store and soon learned to make shoes. As the job did not require much leg movement he could spend more time sitting at work which is why he specialized in the manufacture and repair of shoes. Oscar now has many clients, and it is a good and profitable business.

The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of leather, which will enable him to continue working, either making or repairing shoes. He is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity he is being given to succeed and continue working.

loans.use: to buy leather for his workshop.

loans.name: Clemente Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Clemente tiene 50 años y es casado tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de  11 y 17 años, se dedica a la  Tapicería su taller se  encuentran en la zona 21 de enero, esta es la primera secuencia de su crédito dentro de la institución, el Sr. Clemente utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de materiales para la  fabricación de un  juego de living  ya que tiene un pedido que entregar,  la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, el Sr. Clemente enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la competencia en el mercado y utilizara los beneficios para seguir creciendo en su actividad, el deseo del  Sr. Clemente es comprar una camioneta para poder transportar sus productos, se siente muy feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Clemente is 50 years old. He is married with two children who are 11 and 17 years old. He has an upholstery business. His workshop is located in zone 21 of Enero. This is the first loan sequence that he has taken out through the institution. Clemente will use the loan to buy materials to make a living room set which has already been ordered by a customer. The reason he has decided to take out a loan is to increase his working capital. The challenges he faces in his business are competition in the market and using the profits to continue growing his business. Clemente wants to be able to buy a truck to use to transport his products. He is very happy and thankful for the support that the institution has provided.

loans.use: to buy materials to make a living room set.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is married with 3 children. Leo is 56 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Leo is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years. He has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for his rice field and to purchase an additional parcel of rice land. 

Leo has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Leo hopes to purchase additional parcel of rice land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice field and to purchase an additional parcel of rice land

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is a married woman with four children aged 7, 10, 15 and 17. She lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Ernestina sells buko (coconut) salad and ice candy to her community. Ernestina's husband is a farmer. She also helps her husband maintain their rice farm and sell their produce at the market.
