Reyna Maria es una emprendedora parte de este grupo, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es al destace de cerdos ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio sus clientes ya están definido a los cuales les ofrece, la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra  cerdos y poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en: 'Jehová Es Mi Pastor' (The Lord is my Shepherd) community bank is made up of 13 entrepreneurs who are from the same town.  Each of them has their own business.  They all support each other and give each other advice regarding their businesses.  These entrepreneurs are existing clients of Fundación León 2000.  They used their previous loan to increase their stock.  Reyna Maria is an entrepreneur who belongs to this group.  Her business is slaughtering pigs and she has years of experience in her business.  She has a well-defined customer base to whom she offers her products.  The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy pigs so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut and the Satya Laksana group continue to take out a new loan. They will still need a new loan until they can support their businesses by themselves. Now they are putting savings aside from their profit to use for capital later.

Ni Ketut will use this loan to purchase one sow. Now she has two sows and she has a plan to be a piglet seller. The group have a bigger loan size because they want to increase the population of pigs and the price for feed is quite expensive now.

loans.use: To purchase a sow

loans.name: Freddy Wilson

texts.es: Freddy de 49 años vive ( duran primavera) ecuador – el se dedica a la profesión de ser peluquero.co muchas ganas el trabaja todos los días para poder solventar a su familia.el trabaja solo hasta la 21:00. A futuro el desea tener otro local que sea grande. Con el préstamo comprara (mas mercadería)como tintes, tigeras, herramientas.
texts.en: Freddy is 49 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran, Ecuador.  His profession is hairdressing.  He works every day with a lot of enthusiasm so that he can provide for his family.  He works alone until 9 o'clock at night.  In the future, he would like to have larger premises.  He will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as dyes, scissors and tools.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on her $600 capital so that she can serve more customers

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, lives at Batu Ampar-Singaraja, North of Bali. He has one 3-year-old son and his wife is a housewife. Ahmad works as a fisherman. He goes to the sea three times a week. To support his business, he rents a boat. 

Ahmad has a dream to have a boat of his own. To make it come true, he is taking out a loan from MUK. The loan use to purchase a boat for 5M IDR, a boat engine 2,5M IDR and 10 nets @ 450.000 IDR. And he is borrowing 10M IDR. 

Ahmad sells various kinds of fish. Per kg the fish price is 15.000 IDR and Ahmad gets 30 – 50 kg of fish if the weather is good. He hopes he can develop his business because now he has all the equipment by himself.

loans.use: To purchase a boat, engine and nets

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina de 54 años vive ( Quevedo ecuador ) ella empeso su negocio con poca mercadería. Ella decidió seguir este negocio para mejorar su situación económica . con mucho esfuerzo y ganas trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos . a futuro ella anhela tener unbuen negocio grande. Con el préstamo comprara ( vitrina )vitrinas, bebidas, enlatados.
texts.en: Agustina is 54 years old and lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  She set up her business with just a little merchandise.  She decided to start this business in order to improve her financial situation.  She works every day with the help of her children and with a lot of effort and enthusiasm.  In the future, she would like to have a large business.  She will use her loan to buy display cases, drinks and canned food.

loans.use: to buy display cases, drinks and canned food

loans.name: Obed Riston

texts.en: Obed Riston, 32, is living in the city of Negara, west Bali. He works selling mobile phone vouchers and this business has already been running for two years. He is asking for a loan of 3M IDR to purchase mobile phone vouchers and also mobile phone accessories. Because now he has more customers, he needs to expand his business inventory. Obed Riston plans to save the profit for his future life. Now he lives alone and all the saving will be used for the preparation of his marriage later on.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone vouchers and mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Rumpis Rajawali Group

texts.en:
Lili is a mother of two children. She has been selling motorcycle accessories for five years in front of her house. Her business is running smoothly and she has a lot of customers. Her husband works as a laborer in a tire company and both of them create income that can improve family living conditions. Now she is taking out a loan from VisionFund Indonesia to buy more helmets and raincoats to sell because now in Jakarta at noon comes pouring rain. 

In the future she hopes her business will keep on existing and she can add more variety of motorcycle accessories in her store. She also hopes that she can send her children to university to get a better education than she was able to.

Other group members sell side dishes, snacks and "nasi uduk" (Indonesian coconut rice).

loans.use: to pay for more helmets to sell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 70 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Flordeliza has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 49 years old, married, and has eight children. She lives in Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. Magdalina used her last loan to pay for ingredients and materials to make snacks. Her business has grown and become successful. 

Magdalina is requesting a new loan, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She hopes to be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Rene Manuel

texts.es:
Rene es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, tiene 21 años y vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país que son “Las Líneas de Nazca”, son jeroglíficos extensos ubicados en la pampa de Nazca y que según estudios eran una especie de calendario astronómico de loa cultura nazca, asimismo esta ciudad posee un clima cálido en cualquier época del año. Rene disfruta de su tiempo libre escuchando música sobre todo para distraerse un poco de lo agotador de su trabajo, como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”.

Gracias a ese entusiasmo y dedicación el trabaja en su negocio como chofer de taxi, el trabaja alrededor de diez horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy optimista y porque pone mucho de su parte por hacer bien su trabajo.

Rene está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo y así tener un vehículo en buen estado para trabajar y ofrecer mayor seguridad a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Fundar una empresa de transporte”.
texts.en: Rene is a hard-working and enthusiastic young man. He is 21 years old and lives in the city of Nazca. This city is noted for the fact that it is home to one of the most important tourist attractions in the country, the 'Nazca Lines'. These are large geoglyphs located in the Nazca desert. According to studies, they were a kind of astronomical calendar for the Nazca people. This city is also noted for the fact that it has a hot climate year round. Rene spends his free time listening to music in order to relax a little from the exhaustion of his work. Like all good Peruvians, he really enjoys our traditional cuisine and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious 'arroz con pollo' (chicken and rice). Rene is a keen and committed worker who works around 10 hours a day in his taxi business and can serve up to 20 customers. He believes that his business is doing well because he is very optimistic and puts a lot of work into doing a good job. Rene is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle which means he will have a vehicle which is in a good state of repair. This will allow him to work and offer his customers a safer ride. He will be able to improve his income and continue working in order to achieve his big dream: "To set up a transport company".

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another cart for transporting water to customers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, age 45, who is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Erlando, a vendor, and is the mother of three children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Erlinda operates a market stall. She sells vegetables and condiment items in the community market. She buys vegetables and other common items used in cooking and sells them per kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more quantities of vegetables and condiments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda dreams of giving all her children a good and high-quality education and of building her house in her province. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional vegetables and cooking products needed for her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, a 39-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines, a mother of three children, and wife of Sonny, a driver. She and Sonny manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvira sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct-selling brands such as Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Elvira's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business,Elvira is requesting a Php 11, 000 loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Elvira hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving all of her children a good and high quality education through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mutai

texts.en:
Mutai has been farming for five years in his rural home in Kitale where he lives with his family of three children aged between seven and two years. His mixed farm produces milk, pineapples and tea which he sells locally to earn income to meet daily family needs.

Mutai has requested a loan of 29,000 KES from Juhudi Kiimo in order to buy a chuff cutter which will improve his dairy animal feeding and significantly reduce costly wastage in feeds. Mutai plans to develop his farm into a zero-grazing system.

Mutai says drought and a lack of finances are farmers' main business challenges, but is glad Juhudi Kilimo is providing loans to small farmers.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en: The Sari Pertami group received their new, larger loan. They need a larger loan because the price for animal feed is quite expensive now. Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase two sows. Shes plan to be a piglet seller. The cost can be reduced if keeps piglets rather than fattening hogs. She will sell the piglets to another member. The profits from this business are still to be used to continue to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase two sows.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 36 years old, married, and has six children. With five children in school, Mercy works very hard to provide for them. 

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. 

Mercy has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, etc. 

In the future Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda, a 45-year-old married mother of five children aged between 7 and 23 years, runs a tailoring business in Trinidad, Bohol. She makes dresses and curtains and also provides alteration services to her community. Wilfreda earns 4000 PHP per month and works hard to help sustain her family, especially her children's education.

Wilfreda is requesting this loan to purchase cloths, threads and needles, and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloths, threads and needles.

loans.name: Mahoudjro Group

texts.fr: MAHOUDJRO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Catherine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Thierry. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Catherine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Catherine vend des friperies de façon ambulante au Benin. Catherine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Catherine et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUDJRO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MAHOUDJRO is a group of three people whose members all live in the same area. The group’s representative is Catherine (whose hand is raised in the photo). She is 41 and married to a man named Thierry. They have four dependent children, all in school. Catherine lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Catherine has been selling second-hand clothing door-to-door in Benin for nearly ten years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

This is the second time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to strengthen their working capital and their activity, and also to better meet the needs of their customers. The first loan was repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie, from Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, is 33 years old, married, and the mother of two children. To make a living, Analie owns and operates a specialized "sari-sari" variety store selling daily-use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for six years, she earns 3,000 PHP a month.

A member of GDMPC since 2009, Analie is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, to purchase daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 33 and is married with six children aged between 18 and 7. She has been in farming since her teenage years and has been meeting all her family's needs. Her farm produces maize, beans, and vegetables for the local market. 

Everlyne has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the acquisition will boost her family's income and enable her add more cows to her farm. 

She says drought and diseases are the main undoing in farming since production is limited to seasons and much of the income is consumed by regular treatment demands.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 38 years old, married, and has three children. With two children in school, Amy works very hard to provide for them. 

Amy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. 

Amy has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, sugar, spices, noodles, etc. 

In the future Amy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Gerita

texts.en:
Gerita is from Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Gerita is married and has five children. To earn a living, Gerita owns a business venture operating transport services. Gerita has been in her business for four years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Gerita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Gerita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a resident of Muranga in Central Kenya where he has practiced mixed farming for over twelve years. He currently employs one farmhand and produces eggs, milk and other horticultural products. He is married with three children all of school-going ages. 

John has requested a loan of 95,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a generator and a water pump for irrigation at his farm. He believes sufficient water at the farm will help him produce a variety of fruits and improve his income which will in turn enable him educate and feed his children. 

He says intervention by Juhudi Kilimo with this loan is timely since inadequacy of funds and poor markets for the farm produce remain the leading challenges to farmers.

loans.use: To buy a generator and a water pump

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 43 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for her family.

Marilou runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Marilou has been in this business for 12 years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, spices, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, 29, is a married resident of Kitale. She has four children between 14 and 2 years old. Three of them are schooling. 

She has been in farming for nine years and currently also runs a retail shop in the local market for additional income. She has hired the services of one farmhand. 

Edna has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo for buying and insuring a dairy cow. She says she wants to raise the number and quality of her dairy cows and double her milk production in order to counter the fluctuation in milk prices that causes much variance in her income.

She says that those fluctuations in milk prices as well as the high cost of inputs and unreliable rains are the leading challenges in her business. 

She hopes to repay the loan and acquire a bigger amount later.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mahounan Group

texts.fr: MAHOUNAN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du  groupe, Suzanne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un photographe du nom de Donatien. Le couple a un enfant qui n’est pas encore scolarisé et est à leur charge. Suzanne vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de huit ans, Suzanne vend des tissus et des conserves de façon ambulante au Benin. Suzanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Suzanne et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUNAN sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier  crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Mahounan is a group of three peole who all live in the same neighborhood. The group's leader, Suzanne (with her hand raised in the photo), is 26 years old and married to a photographer named Donatien. The couple has one child who does not go to school yet, and who is in their care. Suzanne lives with her husband and child. She and her husband are both responsible for meeting the household's various expenses.  

For almost eight years, Suzanne has been selling fabric and canned food on foot in Benin. Suzanne obtains her supplies in a market in Benin. This is the second time that Suzanne and the other members of the Mahounan group have asked for financial support from ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and better meet customer demand. The first loan was fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and canned food.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 43 years old and married. She has six children, with two in school. Sarah works very hard to provide for them.

Sarah runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc. 

Sarah requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

In the future Sarah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a mother of four children between 23 and 6 years old.

She has been in farming for five years. Her farm produces milk, maize and vegetables that she sells in the local market. She runs a hotel too, to cushion her farming income in meeting family needs.

Ruth has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. She says the boost and diversification in farming will help her pay for the education of her children and later buy a motorcycle to help her enter into the transport business as well. Her focus is to own 3,000 birds in her farm.

She says that food shortage for poultry is a major challenge to farmers in the area, though the market for birds is readily available.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 38-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 11 and 17. She describes herself as honest. 

Mwanakombo operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a residential area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a shortage of clothes for selling. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Mwanakombo's dream and business goal is to own a boutique within five years. In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 36 years old and married.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Alma has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Alma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Aissata Samba

texts.fr:
Madame Aissata Samba âgée de 46 ans, marié et mère de 5 enfants dont l’ainé a 27 ans et le cadet 7 ans fait du commerce depuis 2008. Elle vient solliciter pour une 3ème fois un crédit de 300000F CFA  pour acheter des habits, des pagnes et des chaussures afin de les revendre dans le marché local.
Elle n’a pas de charge qui l’encombre sinon ses propres charges. C’est pourquoi elle réussi tout de même à épargner et à payer correctement son crédit.
Selon elle ,la meilleure façon de garder de l’argent est de le transformer en bijoux de valeur comme l’or. C’est pourquoi elle se fixe comme projet futur : d’acheter beaucoup de ce métal précieux.
texts.en:
Aissata Samba is 46 years old, married, and mother of five children. Her eldest child is 27 years old, and her youngest child is 7. She has been selling goods since 2008.

She is seeking a third loan of 300,000 CFA to buy clothing, loincloths, and shoes in order to resell them at the local market.

She is not burdened by any expenses other than her own. That's how she is able to save up and correctly pay off her loan. 

According to her, the best way to keep money is to invest it in valuable jewelry, like gold. That's why she has given herself a project for the future: to buy lots of precious metals.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and loincloths intended for resale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 53 years old and married. She has seven children.

Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling piglets. 

Judith requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Judith has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Milanieta

texts.en:
Milanieta is 44 years old and married.

Milanieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Milanieta has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Milanieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Marites runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.  She also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets.

Marites is requesting her sixth loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items to sell.  Marites aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and has three children. 

To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business buying and selling fish in the local community. Virginia has been in her business for 22 years and earns 5,800 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2011, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 52 years old, married and has three children. 

Lolita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Lolita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines and for repairs to her pig cage.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines and for repairs to her pig cage.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: This time Juanita is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Anzhelika

texts.ru:
Анжелика занимается предпринимательской деятельностью начиная с 2010 года. Она продает парфюмерию, средства по уходу за телом и волосами, косметику и т.д. Всю необходимую продукцию для своего бизнеса Анжелика еженедельно заказывает из города Ереван. Анжелика имеет много частных заказов от своих постоянных клиентов, поэтому большую часть товаров она заказывает по индивидуальным заказам клиентов.        
Анжелике 36 лет. Она родилась в Туркменистане, но в возрасте 15 лет вместе с родителями переехала в Армению и поселилась в городе Капане. По специальности Анжелика бухгалтер. Она замужем и у нее двое детей школьного возраста. Муж Анжелики работает в военной части. 
Анжелика работает без выходных и помогает своему мужу содержать семью.  Ей необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для приобретения большой партии парфюмерии и косметики для своего бизнеса. Данный кредит является вторым по счету, получаемым Анжеликой от организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon).
texts.en:
Anzhelika has been an entrepreneur since 2010. She sells perfume, skin and hair care products, cosmetics, etc. Anzhelika orders her merchandise weekly from suppliers in the city of Yerevan. She receives many personal requests from her regular clients, and so the majority of products are ordered according to their individual needs.

Anzhelika is 36 years old. She was born in Turkmenistan but moved to Armenia with her parents at the age of 15 and settled in the city of Kapan. She is an accountant by profession. Anzhelika is married and has two school-age children. Her husband works at a military base. Anzhelika works without days off, helping her husband provide for their family. She needs a loan of 1,000,000 dram to purchase a large shipment of perfume and cosmetics for her business. This Anzhelika's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy a large shipment of perfume and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her business.

Emelyn has been in this business for eight years. Emelyn earns additional income from her general store.

Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Esthela

texts.es: Esthela de  45 años vive( guasmo Guayaquil) ella decidió ponerse el negocio de vender almuerzos tras la perdida de su esposo. Con mucho esfuerzo y ganas a salido adelante para darle lo mejor a sus hijos. Trabaja todos los días . a futuro ella desea salir adelante con su familia. Con el préstamo comprara (cocina para mejorar la rapides de sus comidas).
texts.en: Esthela is 45 years old and lives in (Guasmo) Guayaquil. She decided to start a business selling lunches after she lost her husband. She works hard every day with the desire to move forward and give her children the best. She wants to provide for her family in the future. With this loan she will buy a stove to prepare her dishes faster.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to build her perimeter wall.

loans.name: Alexandra Catalina

texts.es: Alexandra de 31 años  vive( suburbio Guayaquil ). Ella comenzó siendo peluquera en el 2003. Haciéndoles peinados a sus amigas. Luego decidió ponerse un gabinete y le fue muy bien. Trabaja todos los días en el local o adomicilio. A futuro ella anhela tener una peluquería grande y darle buena salud a sus hijos. Con el préstamo comprara ( shampoo tintes etc)
texts.en: Alexandra is 31 years old and lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She became a hairdresser in 2003 by styling hair for her friends. Then she decided to open a shop, and it has gone well. She works every day, either in the space or at people's homes. Her dream for the future is to have a larger shop and make sure her children enjoy good health. She will buy shampoo, dyes, etc. with this loan.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, dyes, and tools.

loans.name: Ana Fe

texts.en:
Ana Fe is 50 years old, widowed, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines. Ana Fe has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for nine years. 

Ana Fe is requesting a loan for 19,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Ana Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Comercio  (24 De Mayo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Comercio está formado por 13 socias y 2 socios que se reúnen cada quince días en la parroquia Bellavista del cantón 24 De Mayo lugar conocido por su vegetación, aquí la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y cría de animales. Ellos llevan tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y están muy contentos con la ayuda de la institución.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 50 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo sola con sus seis hijos, en la actualidad ya cuatro de ellos son mayores de edad y dos de 15 y 13 años que estudian en colegio, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella.
 
Ella para ganarse el sustento diario y para que a sus hijos no les faltara nada desde hace muchos años se dedico a trabajar en la iglesia de su parroquia realizando quehaceres  de limpieza y otras actividades, pero  como esto no le era suficiente para poder solventar los gastos que generaban la crianza de sus hijos,  una amiga un dia la incentivó para que se dedicara a vender ropa, ella ahora comparte el tiempo entre el trabajo en la iglesia  y  las ventas de ropa que las realiza por las tardes y en las  noches. Lleva dos años con sus ventas y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda ya que los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Comercio" is made up of 13 women and 2 men who meet every 15 days in Bellavista parish in the "24 de Mayo" canton, a place known for its vegetation.  Most people who live here work as merchants or farmers, or they raise animals.  These individuals have been with their communal bank for 3 loan cycles, and they are very pleased with the help that they have been getting from the institution.

In this place we meet Rosa, who is 50 years old.  Her husband died a number of years ago and left her alone with their 6 children.  Now 4 of these children are adults, while the other two, aged 13 and 15, are in school.  Three of her children still live with her.

In order to make a living, and to meet the needs of her children, Rosa has worked for many years in her parish church, doing chores such as cleaning and other activities.  But, as this did not generate enough income to cover her household expenses and the expenses of raising her children, a friend motivated her to start to sell clothing.  Now, she shares her time between working at the church and selling clothing, which she does in the evenings and nights.  Rosa has been selling clothing for 2 years, and this business is going very well.

Rosa will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.  This is her 3rd loan cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because the loans have been a great help to her with her business.

Rosa's dream is for her children to have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old, separated, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines. Elizabeth has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has two children. For the last six years, she has earned a living by running a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers. Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is aged 35 and has earned a living as a farmer for the last 10 years. Her farm currently produces bananas, maize, beans and milk for the local market, and the money she earns allows her to meet her family's needs. She is married and has three children who range in age from 4 to 16 years old. She is requesting a loan for KES 60,000, which she intends to use in a constructing a grazing area for her dairy cows. She will also increase the number of her cows to five within five years. She believes the resulting increase in income will make life better for her family. Her main challenge is insufficient rain, which makes feeding her cattle costly and difficult.

loans.use: to build a grazing area for her cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer and shelves.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 59 years old, widowed and has six children. She is in the livestock-raising business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to  raise and sell. She has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Remedios would like to save money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 52 years old, married and has 6 children 2 of whom are in school.

Lucita is in the agricultural business of hog raising in the Philippines. Lucita requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucita has been hog raising for 7 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lucita would like to save money to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a widowed mother of five children. She is 53 years old.She knits sweaters and has been in the business for the past eleven years.

This is Ruth's first term loan from KADET LTD.She was brought to KADET LTD, by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase an over lock machine and knitting yarns for use in her business.

She hopes to expand her business and create employment for others.

loans.use: to purchase an over lock machine and knitting yarns for use in her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 42, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Valeriano, an employee, They have two children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Imelda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Imelda is requesting a Php18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Imelda hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: This time Rosita is borrowing Php 16,000 to fund her hog raising business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Rosita and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
This is Consorcia, 54, who lives in Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and the mother of six children. She and her children manage their own household while operating a business where she buys candy and toys from wholesalers, then repacks them for sale at a small profit. Her customers are attracted by the low prices and many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to expand her product inventory by buying more candies and toys. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Consorcia hopes to grow her business, and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Bible, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy candies and toys to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, age 55, has a retail shop from which she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She and her husband have 10 children.

Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her shop.

In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines. Ruth has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. 

Ruth is requesting a loan for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Ruth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, age 43, operates a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She also prepares and sells viands and fruits. She has had this business for six years. She and her husband have three children.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages to offer for sale in her retail store as well as to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages to offer for sale in her retail store as well as to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en: Felicita is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 10 years. She describes herself as an innovative woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are town people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for selling. Felicita's dream and business goal is to run an exhibition selling clothes mall within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.en:
Juan Pablo has a passion for protecting the environment and a love for cars. After his career on the Olympic Karate Team of Honduras ended with a serious injury, Juan Pablo turned his attention to these passions. 

He worked to develop his own concept for a green, waterless carwash. In 2009, he moved to Miami, Florida from Honduras to promote his product and further develop his business. When developing this solution, he focused his attention on creating an all-purpose wash that could be used for all vehicles and had the environment in mind. The solution that he developed was a dirt and oil remover that did not include the harmful ingredients found in most chemical detergents, and that could be used in the absence of water. 

Juan Pablo now would like to get his product to the mass market with smart advertising. He would like to see his product used across the United States, and would like this loan to market his product outside of his South Florida community.

loans.use: To invest in a media and radio marketing campaign

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 48 years old, married, and has two children. He describes himself as a creative man. He operates a butcher shop, which he has been doing for four years.  He employs one staff member. His business is located at an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Noel is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy more meat.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. His business goal is to run another butcher shop within five years.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel, age 36, runs a retail shop where she buys and sells personal accessories and school supplies. She has had this business for six years. She is widowed and has three children.

Russel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000 to buy stocks of personal accessories and school supplies to offer for sale.

In the future, Russel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy personal accessories and school supplies to offer for sale

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie, age 31, operates a shop where he sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for four years. He is unmarried and is the father of one child.

Ronnie has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011. He has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.  

In the future, Ronnie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Domingga, age 72, owns and operates a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She and her husband have eight children.

Domingga has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. She has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
 
In the future, Domingga hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 64, runs a variety store to earn an income. She has been in this business for five years and sells items such as shampoo, canned goods, detergent, and snack foods. She and her husband have six children and she works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 37 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Virginia has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Virginia requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her furniture making business.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her furniture making

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad. Él vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad rural llamada Morropón en Piura. Esta familia goza de buenas referencias pues son muy unidos y trabajadores. Ignacio se dedica a la compra y venta de cervezas. Este negocio le ha traído buenas recompensas que le han ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida. Es por ello que desea seguir invirtiendo en él y ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de cerveza y en otro negocio de compra de maíz en grano que luego comercializa. Ignacio recibe el apoyo de su esposa en las actividades que realiza, las cuales son el sustento del hogar, es por ello que este crédito le sería de mucha ayuda a su familia. Ignacio es un cliente recurrente de nuestra institución y goza de buenas referencias crediticias por su puntualidad a la hora de cancelar los préstamos.
texts.en:
Ignacio is a 54-year-old father.  He lives with his wife and two children in a rural community called Morropón, in Piura.  This family has good references because they are very close and hardworking.

Ignacio buys and sells beer.  This business has brought him good earnings that have helped him improve his quality of life.  That is why he wants to keep investing in it.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3000 PEN that he will invest in buying beer and in another business, buying kernel corn that later he will sell.  Ignacio has the support of his wife in the activities he does, with which he supports the household.  That is why this loan would be a big help for his family.

Ignacio is a regular client of our institution and he has good credit references because of his punctuality when it comes to paying back the loans.

loans.use: to buy beer and kernel corn to sell.

loans.name: Janny Marleny

texts.es:
Janny tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, vive junto a su familia en casa propia, en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, las cuales son procesadas para ser exportadas a otros países. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella ha decidido apoyar a su pareja, quien se dedica netamente a la agricultura, en el sostenimiento de su familia incursionando en la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza vía catálogo. Ella se esfuerza por mantener su actividad, siempre buscando nuevos clientes a los cuales ofrecerles sus productos.  Asimismo se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores en el mercado de su zona.

En los últimos meses su negocio está gozando de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, por lo que está pensando comprar mercadería (más productos de belleza) y ofrecerla a su clientela de modo que no tengan que esperar siempre por su producto hasta fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido. Para lograr su objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Janny es una madre bastante luchadora y que gusta mucho de sentirse activa. Ella ha sabido ganarse a sus vecinos, los cuales la respetan y estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Janny is 29 years old and lives with her partner.  She has three minor children and lives with her family in her own house in the district of Tambogrande, a district dedicated mainly to growing fruit, which is processed to be exported to other countries.  It is in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has decided to help her partner, who works in agriculture, in supporting the family by getting into selling cosmetics and beauty products via catalogue.  She makes an effort to support her work, always looking for new customers to whom to sell her products.  She also works buying and selling small animals in the market of her area.

In the past few months her business has enjoyed very good reception from her customers, so she is planning to buy merchandise to offer to her customers so they do not always have to wait for the product until the end of the month, which is when the order arrives.  To realize her goal she has seen the need to request for the first time a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa, so they will help her achieve her goal.

Janny is a mother and a real fighter who very much likes to be active.  She has learned how to win over her neighbors, who respect and admire her a lot.

loans.use: to buy poultry and more beauty products.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny, age 27, operates a general store business to earn an income. She has had this business for the past year. She also earns additional income from pearl vending. She and her husband have one child. Jenny works hard to help provide for her family. 

Jenny has repaid five previous loans from NWTF before this loan. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.

Jenny aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Mercy Veronica

texts.es:
Mercy tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y es madre soltera.  Habita en casa propia y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la comunidad, en el distrito de Olmos.  La comunidad es pequeña y los lugareños son muy amables y respetuosos.
Mercy se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace 2 años en la zona del Virrey a una hora de olmos.
Mercy desea invertir en su negocio, específicamente para el arreglo de corral y compra de alimentos, como maíz, para que de esa manera tenga mejores ingresos y por ende una mejor condición de vida en la zona.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
El mercado es  bueno para este tipo de negocio, ya que los pobladores en su mayoría se dedican a la crianza y venta de ganado menor.
El objetivo principal de Mercy es vender a un buen precio sus animales con la inversión en los alimentos y así tenga buenas utilidades, para ello se esfuerza al máximo para alcanzar su meta, pues trabaja más de 8 horas diarias.
texts.en:
Mercy is 30, has 3 children, and is a single mother.  She lives in her own home and has good personal and professional references in the community in the district of Olmos.  It is a small community, and the locals are friendly and respectful.

Mercy has raised and sold small animals for 2 years in the Virrey area, which is one hour from Olmos.  She hopes to invest in her business, specifically in fixing her corral and buying food like corn.  This will let her make a better income and therefore have better living conditions.  This is why she thought it was a good idea to obtain a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

The market is good for this type of business since the majority of people in the area raise and sell small livestock.  Mercy's goal is to sell her animals at a good price and to invest in their food.  This is why she is putting forth maximum effort to reach her goal.  She works more that 8 hours a day.

loans.use: to fix her corrals and buy nutritious food for her livestock.

loans.name: Susumi

texts.es: Susumi vive en uno de los barrios más tradicionales de la ciudad, justamente en el sur de ella, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos. Su potencial comercial es tradicional en su familia, pues su hermano tiene un restaurante en otro país mientras que su madre también vende mercancías, actividad que Susumi aprendió de ella, por eso tiene un restaurante donde vende almuerzos, que también aprovecha para ofrecer minutos a celulares. Ella inició en otro barrio, pero cuando tomó la suficiente experiencia, hace 3 años, se trasladó a un sector mucho más comercial ubicado sobre un boulevard donde se reúne diariamente  vecinos en las noches, hay varias empresas  y transita mucha gente. En la actualidad cuenta con 2 ayudantes para vender sus almuerzos y una en la venta de minutos a  celulares. Su negocio le ha ayudado a convertir los sueños de su hija en realidad, porque es toda una profesional y esto es gracias al trabajo de Susumi en su negocio y a la disciplina de estudio de su hija que hoy es una enfermera profesional y que actualmente se encuentra en otro país para seguir progresando y convertirse en médica. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará sillas, mesas, recargas y materias primas en mayor volumen y de contado para obtener descuentos y ofrecerle mayor confort a sus clientes.
texts.en: Susumi lives in one of the most traditional neighbourhoods in the south of the city. She lives with her husband and two children. Her line of work is in keeping with her family's traditions; her brother owns a restaurant in another country and her mother sells merchandise. Susumi learned salesmanship from her mother; now, she has a restaurant where she sells lunches and also sells cell phone minutes. She started off in another neighbourhood--but three years ago, when she had accumulated the necessary experience, she moved to a much more commercial area located on a boulevard where the neighbours meet every evening. There are various business located nearby, and the area is highly trafficked. Susumi currently has two helpers in her business. Her business has allowed her to make her childhood dreams reality; she is a professional, thanks to her hard work. Her daughter is a nurse, thanks to her hard work, and is currently living in another country studying to become a doctor. Susumi is currently applying for a Kiva loan, with which she will purchase a large quantity of chairs, tables, refills, and basic materials in cash in order to get a discount and offer better comfort to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of chairs, tables, refills and basic materials, in cash.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las Gaviotas” se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 18 integrantes, de la ciudad de Asunción, todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas y están muy orgullosas de ello.
Maria vende jeans, y nos comenta que siempre tiene buena venta ya que siempre tiene muy variadas clases, por esto ya tiene muchas clientas y clientes que le hacen pedidos. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y a su habilidad para las ventas ha podido ir creciendo y de esa forma obteniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos del día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jeans, con lo cual podrá seguir vendiendo y atrayendo a más clientes. Ella y su grupo están contentas por la ayuda que están recibiendo por parte de la fundación y de Kiva.
texts.en:
The “Las Gaviotas” ["The Gulls"] communal bank is in its fourth cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya's Female Entrepreneurs program. There are 18 members, all from the city of Asunción. They each have profitable businesses and are very proud of them.
Maria sells jeans. She tells us that she always has good sales because she always has a great variety of jeans and therefore many customers, some of whom make orders. Thanks to her hard work and her gift for making sales, she has been able to continue expanding her business and obtaining the means to help her family with their daily costs of living.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of jeans. With this purchase, she will be able to continue selling and attracting more customers. She and her group are happy to have this help from the Fundación and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy jeans for sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 52 years old and married with four children. Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Gina has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from a local eatery.

Gina aspires to save enough money to build a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena, age 35, runs a general store business where she sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, sardines, soft drinks, sugar, and coffee. She has been in this business for two years. She and her husband have seven children. With six of her children enrolled in school, Morena works very hard to provide for them.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items to sell in her store.

In the future, Morena would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es:
Maria tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo se caracteriza por la generosidad de sus pobladores y su buena sazón para la preparación de los platillos típicos de la ciudad como lo son “la Carapulcra y la Sopa seca; pero el plato favorito de María es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”; Maria es madre de un pequeño de 11 años, al cual ama mucho y es su razón de vivir y por el cual ella trabaja muy duro para que el tenga una buena calidad de vida y sea mejor que ella.

Maria se dedica a la preparación y venta de cachina y vino, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias, ella ofrece sus productos según los pedidos que tiene de otras ciudades del país, ella envía por vía terrestre dos veces al mes y durante el mes atiende alrededor de 10 clientes,, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad y porque tiene una buena presentación.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar más insumos ( uva , botellas para envasar, etiquetas, entre otros), para la elaboración de sus productos, lo que le permitirá tener mas mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando para poder cumplir su mas grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material de concreto y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and lives in the city of Chincha, a city known as the birthplace of the great glories of Peruvian sports as well as for the generosity of its inhabitants and its flavorful typical dishes such as “Carapulcar” and “Sopa seca”. Maria’s favorite dish is the delicious “Arroz Chaufa.” 

Maria is the mother of an 11 year old whom she dearly loves. He is her reason for living and working so hard. She wants to insure that he has a good quality of life and that it will be better than hers. 

Maria prepares “cachina” and other wines. She works around 8 hours a day and sells her product to other cities in the country on order, sending it by land transport twice a month. She fills orders from about 10 clients a month. She believes that her business is doing well because of the quality of her product and because her wines have a good presentation.

Maria is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more supplies (grapes, bottles to fill, labels, among other items) in order to prepare her product, which will enable her to have more inventory to offer her customers.  Consequently she will be able to improve her income and continue fighting to fulfill her greatest dreams of building her house of concrete material and giving her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as grapes, bottles to fill and labels among other items.

loans.name: Hanilet

texts.en:
Hanilet is 21 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Hanilet runs a pearl vending business in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. Hanilet has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Hanilet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Timmy

texts.en:
Timmy is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.

Timmy has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas and firewood. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stock of bananas and firewood to sell.

Timmy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Timmy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of bananas and firewood to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, age 47, is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has an Internet cafe business, which she has run for eight years. She and her husband have four children, one of whom is enrolled in school.
 
Evelyn has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional computer set-ups for her Internet cafe.

In the future, she would like to save enough to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional computer set-ups for her Internet cafe.

loans.name: Maria Evangeline

texts.en:
Maria Evangeline earns an income as a fish vendor. She works hard to support her family. She has operated her business for 10 years.

Maria Evangeline has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda, age 49, has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She and her husband have two children.

Medarda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 18,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. 

In the future, Medarda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 40-year-old married man and father of five children. Khalil has twenty years of experience in selling food and necessary goods. In 2008, he opened his grocery store and started to improve it gradually.

Khalil is a hardworking man. He does his best to provide his family with the best and healthiest living. Khalil is well known in his region and most of his customers are friends, relatives and neighbors who enjoy dealing with him. Khalil is planning to expand his business more and more in the future through opening another branch or starting wholesale trade.

Now he is applying for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise with special goods requested by his customers.

He is sure that this loan will reflect positively on his social and financial situations.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with special goods requested by his customers

loans.name: Evengeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, age 48, runs a variety store business. She has operated this business for five years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and sells such items as snack foods and soap in her shop. She and her husband have six children, two of whom are enrolled in school.

Evangeline has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items such as snack foods and soap to sell in her store.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as snack foods and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Mildred

texts.en:
Maria Mildred, age 42, runs a variety store where she sells such items as shampoo, snack foods, and soft drinks. She has been in this business for three years. She and her husband have four children. With two of her children enrolled in school, Maria Mildred works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Mildred has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.

In the future, Maria Mildred would like to save enough money to be able to afford to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, age 53, operates a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She and her husband have five children.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 17,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. 

In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. 

He has been operating an aluminum workshop to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed three people. 

He started in the business with financial help from one of his relatives. Then he worked hard to save money until he was able to open his own aluminum workshop. 

Anwar describes his business environment as good because he is visited regularly by his customers. He has been able to improve his business. 

He has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy aluminum for his business. That will enable him to work well again. 

In the future, he hopes to have a big metal workshop so that his profit will allow him to improve his living conditions as well as to get married.

loans.use: to buy aluminum for his business.

loans.name: Shaif

texts.en:
Shaif is a 28-year-old married man who has one child. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He lives in a renowned area of the city. He has been operating a barber shop for five years. He started his business with a small piece of land where he opened a small barber shop.

He has known how to attract customers through the service that he provides them. His main customers are people living in his neighborhood and the local community. He works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.
 
Being an ambitious man, he would like to expand his business to provide his client's needs and get more profit. So he took a youth loan of 110,000 YER from AMB in order to buy barber chairs, mirrors, combs and creams for his business.

In the future, Shaif would like to provide a private school education for his child and expand his business to open a better barber shop also.

loans.use: to buy barber chairs, mirrors, combs and creams for his business.

loans.name: Lope

texts.en:
Lope is a hard-working entrepreneur who has operated a variety store business for the past eight years. She sells such items as snack foods, detergent, and soap. She earns additional income from selling coconut wine and from engaging in abaca weaving. 
 
She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as snack foods, detergent, and soap to sell in her store.

Lope has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items such as snack foods, detergent, and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Now requesting her fifth loan for Php 15,000, Elvira will use the money to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA and continues to provide her and her family with support that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 62 years old and married.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business hog raising in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlinda has been hog raising for 3 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 34 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Guillerma has a chocolate making business in the Philippines. Guillerma requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her chocolate making.

Guillerma has been in this business for 5 years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her chocolate making.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. She is single and has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines.

Annabelle requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy a manicure set and clothing.

Annabelle has been in this business for 20 years now, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business and to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy a manicure set and clothing.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, age 52, is a hard-working entrepreneur who earns an income by making and selling brooms. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years. She and her husband have four children, one of whom is still in school.

Alma has requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for broom-making.
 
Alma would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for broom-making

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
Rolinda is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 
Rolinda has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. Her husband is providing motorcycle services.She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Rolinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Rolinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Lucia  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ana Lucila

texts.en:
Ana Lucila, age 49, operates a food shop or "carenderia," where she prepares and sells viands like adobo, bulalo, and halang-halang. She has had this business for 12 years. She and her husband have four children.

Ana Lucila has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for making viands.

In the future, Ana Lucila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for making viands

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise, age 38, operates a retail business, selling milk. She has been involved in this business for three years.
